career_spirit_warden_wardens_binding_cir: Type: Maneuver (Ritual) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — After one full Round of uninterrupted work, create a reinforced ritual circle. While you remain inside it, gain +1 bonus die on banish actions against Bound Spirits, and Greater Spirits inside suffer 1 penalty die on actions directly opposing you. Once this Scene, while inside this circle, reduce the Strain cost of one Summoning action you perform by 1.
career_spirit_warden_wardens_wards_rules: Type: Reaction (Interdict) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You or an ally within Short is targeted by a possession or spirit-origin effect. Effect: Reduce the effect by 1d6, or negate a single possession attempt from a Lesser Spirit. This reduction does not stack with other reductions from Spirit Warden talents.
career_stormweaver_arc_feedback_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Disrupt) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You are hit by a melee attack. Effect: Roll Magic (Elemental) opposed by the attacker’s CON. On a success, the attacker suffers 1 penalty die on their next action and cannot make Reactions until the end of the round.
career_stormweaver_arc_flare_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Dazzle) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: After you successfully resolve an Elemental spell against a target in Engaged. Effect: Roll Magic (Elemental) opposed by the target’s CON. On a success, the target suffers 1 penalty die on their next action taken before the end of their following turn.
career_stormweaver_burn_current_rules-u: Type: Action (Elemental Shock) • Cost: 3 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — You release a violent surge of elemental force that you can no longer fully contain. Each enemy currently in Engaged range must oppose your Magic (Elemental) roll with a CON roll. Any target you defeat takes 1d6 Arcane damage and suffers 1 penalty die on their next action before the end of their following turn. Targets that succeed suffer no damage and no penalty. This effect represents uncontrolled elemental discharge rather than a spell and cannot benefit from spell modifiers, bonus dice, cost reductions, or talents that modify spellcasting.
career_stormweaver_burnline_pressure_rul: Type: Reaction (Zone Pressure) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: An enemy enters or leaves Engaged with you. Effect: Roll Magic (Elemental) opposed by the target’s CON. On a success, the target suffers 1 penalty die on its next action.
career_stormweaver_dig_in_the_storm_rule: Type: Reaction (Stance) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You would be subjected to forced movement, a shove, or a knockdown effect. Effect: You immediately enter a braced stance. Negate that instance of forced movement, and gain +1 bonus die on CON rolls to resist knockdown or shove effects until the end of your next turn. While this stance is active, you cannot benefit from talents that grant additional movement or teleportation.
career_stormweaver_eye_of_the_storm_rule: Type: Free Action (Veil Trance) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Activate at the start of your turn. Until the end of your next turn, you ignore one penalty die imposed on your Elemental spellcasting rolls each round. Once during this duration, you may reroll one failed Elemental spellcasting roll. While this effect is active, you cannot benefit from talents that grant additional movement or teleportation. This talent is not a spell and is not affected by effects that modify or penalize spells unless explicitly stated.
career_stormweaver_flashfire_assault_rul: Type: Special Immediate (Follow-Up) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Immediately after you successfully cast an Elemental spell, make one Melee or Thrown attack against a target in Engaged or Short as an incidental. This attack does not consume your Action, does not grant additional Reactions, and cannot benefit from bonus dice from talents. If this attack misses, you suffer 1 Strain.
career_stormweaver_flashstep_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Mobility) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Immediately take one Move Maneuver. This movement ignores difficult terrain and does not provoke Reactions. You may not gain more than one additional movement effect from Stormweaver talents in the same round.
career_stormweaver_hold_the_current_rule: Type: Free Action (Cast Mod) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Gain +1 bonus die on a Magic (Elemental) roll as you forcibly stabilize volatile energy. If the spell succeeds, resolve its Strain cost normally. If the spell fails, increase the spell's Strain die by one step before rolling Strain.
career_stormweaver_killzone_instinct_rul: Type: Passive (Threat Sense) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — While you are at Engaged or Short range, you gain +10% to Dodge rolls against any enemy that has been successfully affected by one of your Elemental spells earlier this scene. An enemy is considered affected if they failed a resistance roll or otherwise suffered the spell’s primary effect. This benefit does not apply against enemies unaffected by the spell’s resolution.
career_stormweaver_scorchmark_rules-u: Type: Maneuver (Brand) • Cost: 3 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Brand a living enemy within Short with arcane fire. Your next Elemental spell targeting that enemy gains +1 bonus die. The brand ends when that spell resolves, the target dies, or the scene ends. This bonus die does not stack with other talent-granted bonus dice.
career_stormweaver_shockstep_conduit_rul: Type: Action (Teleport) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Teleport to a visible point within Medium. Enemies in Engaged range at your starting and ending positions must each oppose your Magic (Elemental) roll with a CON roll. Any target you defeat takes 1d4 Arcane damage. Targets that succeed suffer no damage. You may not gain more than one additional movement effect from Stormweaver talents in the same round.
career_stormweaver_singularity_discharge: Type: Action (Terminal Overload) • Cost: 1d10 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Choose one hostile creature within Short and roll Magic (Elemental) opposed by the target’s CON. On a success, the target takes 4d6 Arcane damage. On a failure, the target takes 2d6 Arcane damage. Regardless of the outcome, you cannot cast Elemental spells again this scene.
career_stormweaver_stormbreak_rules-u: Type: Action (Structural Rupture) • Cost: 1d8 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Choose a visible terrain feature or structural element within Medium (such as a wall, floor, ceiling, pillar, barricade, or natural formation). You violently rupture it, creating a gaping breach or explosive collapse point. Each hostile creature within Short of that feature must oppose your Magic (Elemental) roll with CON. On a failure, each affected creature takes 2d6 Physical damage and is either knocked Prone or forcibly displaced one range band (your choice) as the structure collapses. This effect does not destroy armored vehicles or hardened military assets and represents catastrophic environmental destruction rather than a spell.
career_stormweaver_stormcallers_edge_rul: Type: Free Action (Overchannel) • Cost: 4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Before you cast an Elemental spell, declare overchanneling. That spell gains +1 bonus die. If the spell succeeds, you may affect one additional valid target within Short of the original target. This talent may not be used on spells that already affect multiple targets. The bonus die from this talent does not stack with other talent-granted bonus dice. This talent cannot be combined with Surge Engine, Veilcore Meltdown, or any effect that sets a spell’s Strain cost to 0.
career_stormweaver_stormpulse_drive_rule: Type: Free Action (Post-Cast) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Immediately after casting an Elemental spell, take one Move Maneuver. This movement follows normal rules, may provoke Reactions, and does not allow you to exceed the normal limit of two Maneuvers per turn. You may not gain more than one additional movement effect from Stormweaver talents in the same round.
career_stormweaver_strain_buffer_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase maximum Strain by +1. (This talent appears in multiple Career Trees.)
career_stormweaver_surge_engine_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Cost Waiver) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Cast your next Elemental spell this turn for 0 Strain. Eligibility: the spell’s base Strain die must be 1d6 or smaller before any modifiers. Anti-stacking: this spell cannot benefit from any other cost-reduction or bonus-die talents.
career_stormweaver_tinder_spark_rules-u: Type: Action (Utility/Fire) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Ignite a flammable object or surface within Short as residual elemental bleed-off escapes containment. If used against a creature in Engaged, roll Magic (Elemental) opposed by the target's CON. On a success, the target suffers 1 penalty die on their next physical action due to heat and distraction.
career_stormweaver_total_elemental_colla: Type: Action (Overload Release) • Cost: 2d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — You release all remaining elemental pressure in a violent, uncontrolled surge. Each hostile creature within Medium must oppose your Magic (Elemental) roll with CON. Any target you defeat takes 3d6 Arcane damage. Targets that succeed take no damage. After resolving this action, you cannot cast Elemental spells or activate talents that modify spells for the remainder of the scene. This effect represents catastrophic elemental failure rather than a spell and cannot benefit from spell modifiers, bonus dice, or cost reductions.
career_stormweaver_veil_backlash_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Disrupt) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: After you take damage from a melee attack. Effect: Roll Magic (Elemental) opposed by the attacker's CON. On a success, the attacker suffers 1 penalty die on their next action as arcane feedback disrupts their movement and focus.
career_stormweaver_veilcore_meltdown_rul: Type: Action (Overchannel Catastrophe) • Cost: 1d8 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — You deliberately overload your elemental channeling. Choose one Elemental spell you cast as part of this action. If that spell deals damage, double the number of damage dice rolled. This effect applies after all other modifiers are determined and cannot be combined with other effects that increase damage dice. After resolving the spell, you suffer 1 penalty die on all Elemental spellcasting rolls until the end of the scene. If the spell fails, it still consumes its normal Strain cost in addition to Veilcore Meltdown’s cost.
career_stormweaver_veilstorm_mantle_rule: Type: Free Action (Storm Cloak) • Cost: 3 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Until the end of your next turn, the first time a creature resolves a melee attack against you, roll Magic (Elemental) opposed by the attacker’s CON. On a success, the attacker suffers 1 penalty die on their next action due to disruptive arcane feedback. While this effect is active, you cannot benefit from talents that reduce Strain cost or Strain dice.
career_stormweaver_volcanic_path_rules-u: Type: Action (Hazard Terrain) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Tear open a line of unstable, burning terrain up to Short in length, placed anywhere within Short of you. The hazard remains until the start of your next turn. The line is wide enough that crossing it requires deliberate movement. When a creature crosses the line, roll Magic (Elemental) opposed by the creature’s CON. On a success, the creature takes 1d6 Physical damage. A creature that chooses to avoid crossing the line must spend one additional Maneuver that turn to cover the same distance. This effect represents unstable elemental terrain rather than a spell and cannot benefit from spell modifiers or bonus-die talents.
career_stormweaver_voltaic_reflex_rules-: Type: Reaction (Jink) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: You are targeted by a ranged attack. Effect: Gain +1 bonus die on your Dodge roll. This bonus die does not stack with other talent-granted bonus dice.
career_street_ronin_blade_discipline_rul: Type: Passive (Substitute) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — When taking the Dodge action while wielding a melee weapon, you may roll Melee Weapons instead of Dodge.
career_street_ronin_breath_before_the_cu: Type: Special immediate (Stance) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — If you win Initiative in a combat scene, enter Duel Focus for Round 1: gain +1 bonus die on melee attacks vs one designated target, and reduce the Strain cost of one Reaction-based talent by one die step for that round.
career_street_ronin_clean_entry_rules-u: Type: Action (Draw & Strike) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Draw and strike with a melee weapon as a single Action. If you begin the scene undetected or neutral, your opening attack this scene gains +1 bonus die.
career_street_ronin_combat_rhythm_rules-: Type: Reaction (Flow) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After you successfully Dodge an attack, gain +1 bonus die on your next Melee Weapons or Coordination roll before the end of your next turn.
career_street_ronin_counterguard_precisi: Type: Reaction (Counter) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After you successfully Dodge a melee attack, make one free melee counterattack with +1 bonus die.
career_street_ronin_deflective_form_rule: Type: Free Action (Deflect) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When targeted by a ranged attack within Short range while wielding a melee weapon, you may attempt to deflect or evade the strike.  You may make a Dodge or Melee Weapons check as a Free Action — this does not count against your normal reaction limit.  If your roll equals or exceeds the attacker’s roll, the attack is avoided.
career_street_ronin_disciplined_focus_ru: Type: Free Action (Ignore Penalty) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Ignore 1 penalty die on a single attack, defense, or Initiative roll.
career_street_ronin_draw_cut_rules-u: Type: Attack modifier • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When striking a target that hasn’t acted yet this scene, deal +1d6 damage and apply 1 penalty die to their next action.
career_street_ronin_duelmasters_claim_ru: Type: Free Action (Mark Rival) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Declare one opponent as your focused rival. For the rest of the scene, gain +1 bonus die on Melee, Dodge, and Reaction-based talents against that target. If you reduce them to 0 HP, choose one: free melee attack vs another Engaged target or regain 2 Strain.
career_street_ronin_final_cut_doctrine_r: Type: Reaction (Counter — Finisher) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When counterattacking, declare Final Cut. Win or lose, your attack lands after the attacker’s action resolves, dealing maximum weapon damage. If your counter would have succeeded normally, also apply one other talent effect (e.g., Draw Cut or Posture Breaker) for free.
career_street_ronin_flow_reversal_rules-: Type: Reaction (Clash) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — If your counterattack fails to beat the attacker’s success, force a mutual exchange: both take damage (per the original attack), and the attacker suffers 1 penalty die on their next action.
career_street_ronin_ghost_step_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Reposition) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Move 1 range band as a Free Maneuver, even if you’ve already moved this round. If you aren’t targeted before your next turn, your next melee attack gains +1 bonus die.
career_street_ronin_ghost_walk_execution: Type: Special immediate (Burst) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Move up to Medium as a Free Action and make one melee attack. If the target is unaware or has not acted yet this scene, deal +2d6 bonus damage and force a POW test; on failure, they are Stunned until end of their next turn.
career_street_ronin_interception_cut_rul: Type: Reaction (Interrupt) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: An enemy moves into Engaged with you. Effect: Make one free melee attack; on a hit, their movement is interrupted.
career_street_ronin_moment_severed_rules: Type: Special immediate (Stagger) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — After you land a melee hit, prevent the target from taking Actions until the end of their next turn (they may still take Reactions).
career_street_ronin_no_second_strike_rul: Type: Special immediate (Follow-up) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — If you reduce a target to 0 HP with a melee attack, immediately make one free melee attack against another target in Engaged; that attack gains +1 bonus die.
career_street_ronin_posture_breaker_rule: Type: Special immediate (Debuff) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After a successful melee attack, apply 1 penalty die to the target’s next attack or defense this scene.
career_street_ronin_reactive_flow_rules-: Type: Reaction (Reposition) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: You are missed by a melee attack. Effect: Move 1 range band in any direction as a Free Maneuver.
career_street_ronin_stat_boost_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase any one core stat (including Magic) by +5%, up to racial maximum. May only be taken once.
career_street_ronin_steel_anchored_calm_: Type: Free Action (Resolve) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Ignore effects of fear, pain, or Veil-induced conditions for 1 round; also gain +1 bonus die on Dodge during this time.
career_street_ronin_steel_reflex_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Mitigate) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When targeted by a ranged attack and you are in Cover or Engaged, declare after the attack roll, before damage: reduce damage by 1d6.
career_street_ronin_stillness_in_motion_: Type: Free Action (Mobility Stance) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: At-will — Ignore movement penalties for the rest of the round; during this time, gain +1 bonus die on Athletics or Melee Weapons rolls that involve movement. (Does not grant free Disengage; standard reactions still apply.)
career_street_ronin_strain_buffer_rules-: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase your maximum Strain by +1. (This talent may appear in multiple Career Trees.)
career_street_ronin_the_line_you_do_not_: The Line You Do Not Cross

Type: Maneuver (Threat Line) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Designate a small area within Engaged (doorway, alley, rooftop edge). Enemies who cross this line this turn suffer 1 penalty die on movement or attacks.
career_street_ronin_urban_footwork_rules: Type: Free Action (Terrain) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Gain +1 bonus die on Dodge or Athletics while moving through tight spaces, vertical terrain, or cluttered urban environments this round.
career_veil_dancer_body_like_a_falling_s: Type: Action (Impact Descent) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Move up to two range bands in a straight line toward a point you can see, ignoring difficult terrain and vertical distance. When you land, all enemies within Engaged range must oppose your Magic (Alteration) with STR or DEX. Each creature you defeat takes 2d6 Arcane damage, is knocked Prone, and becomes Impaired until the end of its next turn. You remain standing at the center of the impact.
career_veil_dancer_borrowed_horizon_rule: Type: Free Action (Spatial Rewrite) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — At any point during your turn, choose one visible creature within Medium range. You immediately reposition to any space at Engaged or Short range relative to that creature that you could physically occupy. This movement may cross vertical distance or open space but may not pass through sealed barriers or total cover.
career_veil_dancer_borrowed_trajectory_r: Type: Maneuver (Vector Shift) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Choose one willing ally within Short range. You reposition to any space within Short range of that ally that you could physically reach by normal movement if barriers were not present. If this movement begins while Engaged with a hostile, it counts as a Disengage.
career_veil_dancer_center_of_pressure_ru: Type: Passive (Positional Influence) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — While you are Engaged with at least one hostile creature, hostile creatures within Short range treat voluntary movement away from you as difficult terrain (each range-band change away from you costs one additional Maneuver). This does not apply to teleportation or forced movement caused by allies.
career_veil_dancer_dance_of_the_unbound_: Type: Action (Ascendant Stance) • Cost: 3 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Until the start of your next turn, you may take one additional Maneuver without paying Strain, may Disengage as a Free Action, and gain +10% on all Dodge and Coordination rolls. While this stance is active, you cannot take the Focused Aim action or benefit from effects that require remaining stationary.
career_veil_dancer_flow_entry_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Engagement Shift) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: A hostile creature moves into Engaged range with you. Effect: You may immediately reposition to any other valid space within Engaged range of that creature, or impose 1 penalty die on the triggering attack if it occurs before the end of the creature’s current action. This does not deal damage and does not prevent further Reactions.
career_veil_dancer_flow_severance_rules-: Type: Reaction (Rhythm Break) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: A creature within Engaged range completes an Action. Effect: Roll Magic (Alteration) opposed by the target’s DEX. On a success, the target becomes Impaired until the end of its next turn as its timing and momentum are disrupted. This effect represents broken flow, not pain or fear.
career_veil_dancer_gravity_pin_rules-u: Type: Maneuver (Localized Constraint) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Choose one creature within Short range. Roll Magic (Alteration) opposed by the target’s STR. On a success, until the start of your next turn the target’s voluntary movement is limited to one range band total, and it cannot benefit from effects that grant additional voluntary movement. Disengage is still allowed and costs a Maneuver as normal.
career_veil_dancer_grounded_form_rules-u: Type: Maneuver (Stance) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Until the start of your next turn, the first effect that would knock you Prone or forcibly reposition you instead fails. Any further forced-movement effects during this duration resolve normally. This represents deliberate stabilization rather than immunity.
career_veil_dancer_heavenshattering_sequ: Type: Action (Perfect Assault) • Cost: 2d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Declare a sequence of flawless motion against a single target within Short range. Make up to three melee or unarmed attacks against that target as part of this Action. Each attack is rolled separately and resolves normally. The target may Dodge or Fight Back only once during this sequence; all subsequent attacks bypass Reactions. After the sequence resolves, you may immediately reposition to any space within Short range of the target without provoking Reactions.
career_veil_dancer_impossible_footing_ru: Type: Action (Mythic Movement) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Until the end of your turn, you may move across surfaces that could not normally support you, including vertical walls, unstable debris, narrow ledges, or liquid surfaces. This movement ignores difficult terrain and unstable ground penalties. You must begin and end this movement in a space that can physically contain your body; you cannot end your turn suspended in open air or unsupported space.
career_veil_dancer_inertial_claim_rules-: Type: Action (Engagement Authority) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Choose one creature within Engaged range. Roll Magic (Alteration) opposed by the target’s STR or DEX (target’s choice). On a success, until the start of your next turn, the target cannot voluntarily move beyond Engaged range with you. Disengage is still allowed but costs two Maneuvers instead of one. This effect ends immediately if you leave Engaged range or are incapacitated.
career_veil_dancer_inertial_shear_rules-: Type: Reaction (Force Redirection) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You are hit by a melee or unarmed attack at Engaged range. Effect: Roll Magic (Alteration) opposed by the attacker’s STR. On a success, reduce the damage from that hit by half (rounded down) after Armor, then you may immediately Disengage from that attacker. This Disengage follows all normal rules and does not grant additional movement beyond the Disengage.
career_veil_dancer_kinetic_read_rules-u: Type: Passive (Awareness) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — When a hostile creature enters or leaves Engaged range with you, gain +10% on your next Dodge or Coordination roll made against that creature before the end of your next turn. This bonus does not stack with other talent-granted percentage bonuses. This bonus applies only once per triggering movement.
career_veil_dancer_mass_lock_technique_r: Type: Maneuver (Physics Imposition) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Until the start of your next turn, you dramatically increase your effective mass and inertia. During this time, you cannot be forcibly moved or knocked Prone by effects that do not explicitly ignore stabilization. In addition, the next melee or unarmed attack you hit with before this effect ends deals +1d4 damage after Armor. This bonus damage applies only once and does not stack with other bonus damage effects.
career_veil_dancer_phase_latched_strike_: Type: Action (Commitment) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Make one melee or unarmed attack against a target at Engaged range. If the attack hits, choose one: the target cannot Disengage from you before the start of your next turn, or the target suffers 1 penalty die on its next physical action taken before the end of its next turn.
career_veil_dancer_stillness_between_hea: Type: Reaction (Temporal Interdiction) • Cost: 1d8 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: A visible creature within Short range begins an Action. Effect: Roll Magic (Alteration) opposed by the creature’s DEX (or relevant casting skill, if a spell). On a success, the triggering action is suspended. You immediately take a full turn (Action, Maneuver, Free Actions) outside Initiative. When your turn ends, the suspended action resolves with 1 penalty die. Whether you succeed or fail, you cannot take Reactions until the start of your next turn.
career_veil_dancer_strain_buffer_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase your maximum Strain by +1. (This talent may appear in multiple Career Trees.)
career_veil_dancer_the_veil_remembers_yo: Type: Action (Existential Assertion) • Cost: 1d8 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Until the end of the Scene, the first time you would be reduced to 0 HP or removed from play by forced movement, that effect is negated. You instead reposition to any space within Short range and remain at 1 HP. This effect then ends. The Strain cost is applied immediately when this talent is activated.
career_veil_dancer_vector_reversal_rules: Type: Reaction (Momentum Theft) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: A creature within Short range moves toward or past you as part of its action or ability (including Charges or forced repositioning). Effect: Roll Magic (Alteration) opposed by the mover’s STR or DEX. On a success, the creature’s movement is redirected: it stops at Engaged range with you and cannot continue moving this round. This does not affect teleportation.
career_veil_dancer_veil_reserve_step_rul: Type: Free Action (Economy Adjustment) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When you would spend 3 Strain to take a second Maneuver during your turn, you may instead pay 2 Strain. This affects only the Strain cost; the additional Maneuver follows all normal rules and limitations.
career_veil_dancer_veilbreaker_palm_rule: Type: Action (Altered Strike) • Cost: 3 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Until the end of your turn, the next melee or unarmed attack you successfully hit with deals Arcane damage instead of Physical damage and reduces the target’s Armor by 2 (minimum 0) against that hit only. This effect applies to one attack and does not stack with other effects that reduce or bypass Armor.
career_veil_dancer_veilstep_initiate_rul: Type: Free Action (Reposition) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Immediately move 1 range band. This movement ignores difficult terrain and unstable footing. If this movement begins while you are Engaged with a hostile creature, it counts as a Disengage. You must end this movement in a space you could physically occupy by normal movement; this effect does not allow phasing through solid barriers or sealed spaces.
career_veil_dancer_world_refuses_you_rul: Type: Reaction (Absolute Rebuttal) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You would be forcibly moved, knocked Prone, restrained, grappled, or repositioned. Effect: Negate the triggering effect entirely. If the source was a creature within Engaged or Short range, that creature suffers 1 penalty die on its next action taken before the end of its next turn as the imposed force rebounds against it.
career_veil_dancer_zero_point_mastery_ru: Type: Action (Mythic State) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Until the end of the Scene, you partially sever your relationship with mass and inertia. Each round, you may take one additional Maneuver without paying Strain, and your movement between range bands never provokes Reactions. While this state is active, you cannot be Slowed, Hobbled, knocked Prone, or forcibly repositioned by effects that do not explicitly ignore stabilization. When the Scene ends, you become Exhausted until you recover at least 1 Strain.
ceremonial_talisman-u: A ceremonial talisman—etched bone, red-thread token, or folded charm—used to commune or protect.
clan_ritual_token-u: A horn carving representing your rite of passage — etched by your hand, or someone you lost.
claw_etched_oathstone-u: A claw-etched oathstone or charm fragment from a packmate you lost — or failed.
cliffborn_work_harness-u: A reinforced harness or work belt etched with clan-marks, worn and familiar from years of use.
colony_logistics_contact_desc-u: Familiar with supply chains, shortages, and who still trades honestly beyond the core worlds.
command_presence_desc-u: Once per session, when you assert authority or issue a direct command in a tense situation, gain +1 bonus die on one Intimidate, Persuade, or Leadership roll. If the roll succeeds, the compliance or de-escalation achieved is immediate but short-lived, lasting only long enough to resolve the current moment unless reinforced by further leverage. The action draws attention and may create resentment, scrutiny, or escalation appropriate to the situation.
computer_use_desc-u: TODO: add description for computer use
concealment_rig_desc-u: Hidden compartments, body concealment wear, and tools for moving restricted items unnoticed.
contextual_analysis_desc-u: Once per session, after examining a document, structure, artifact, or recorded data, you may ask the GM one clarifying question about its origin, purpose, or historical significance. The answer will be accurate, but limited to what could reasonably be inferred from available evidence.
control_the_narrative_desc-u: Once per session, when information about an event involving you or your allies begins to spread, you may influence how it is framed. Choose one: the story emphasizes chaos over intent, competence over morality, or confusion over clarity. This does not erase evidence, but it shapes public perception in the short term.
corporate_credentials_desc-u: Active, expired, or falsified ID granting surface-level access to corporate facilities, jargon, and internal processes.
corporate_fixer_desc-u: Specializes in smoothing problems before they reach legal or public exposure.
corporate_framing_desc-u: Once per session, when interacting with a corporate employee, contractor, or institutional authority, you may frame your request or explanation in corporate language. If you do, you may ignore one penalty die imposed due to hierarchy, red tape, or institutional resistance on a Persuade, Bureaucracy, or Law roll. This does not grant obedience—only access and credibility.
corporate_or_political_insider_desc-u: Someone who understands how power actually moves behind closed doors.
debt_marker_desc-u: Proof of a settled—or outstanding—obligation within the Underworld. It has no mechanical effect, but opens doors or causes problems.
defector_or_heretic_desc-u: Someone who left before you—or after—and knows what the doctrine hides.
delusion-da-dec: The Investigator sees things that are not real, but is unable to tell truth from hallucination.
delusion-da-dec2: The investigator has been profoundly affected by a hallucination, causing them to undertake some form action. Perhaps they have dug a deep pit and are now hiding in it, or barricaded themselves within a hut.
department_insider_desc-u: A clerk, dispatcher, or analyst who still has access to records and knows how to quietly move information.
digital_mask_manifest-u: A digital mask manifest — a public record of one of your past identities, still active in the system.
disgruntled_analyst_desc-u: Knows where the numbers don’t add up and who benefits from that fact.
doctrine_before_fear_desc-u: Once per session, when acting in accordance with a belief, doctrine, or oath that meaningfully constrains your choices in the current situation, you may either gain +1 bonus die on a social, resolve-based, or fear-related roll, or ignore one penalty die imposed by fear, intimidation, or emotional pressure. This represents conditioning and conviction—not divine favor. If the roll succeeds, the GM may introduce consequences tied to visibility, dogma, or ideological fallout.
dust_seer_focus_stone-u: A rune-dusted focus stone or bone-scratched prayer ring used in your first divination rite.
duty_gear_desc-u: Protective clothing, restraints, personal comms, and standard non-lethal enforcement tools.
edge_sense_desc-u: Once per session, when entering an unfamiliar or unstable environment, you may ask the GM one of the following questions: What here is most dangerous? or What here is most likely to fail first? The answer will be truthful but not exhaustive.
editor_or_producer_desc-u: Decides what runs, what gets buried, and what needs “one more angle.”
enchanted_cloak-u: A worn but enchanted cloak, noise-dampening footwear, or collapsible climbing tool.
encrypted_commlink_desc-u: Secure device preloaded with corporate-grade encryption, scheduling software, and internal-format documentation templates.
encrypted_dataplate-u: An encrypted dataplate or veil-coded mnemonic implant containing a memory of something you never lived.
encrypted_personal_device_desc-u: A private comms unit, datapad, or credential hub with legacy access frameworks and subtle security features.
enforcer_or_crew_mate_desc-u: Someone who has bled with you and hasn’t forgotten it.
environmental_discipline_desc-u: Once per session, when operating in a hazardous or unfamiliar environment, you may ignore one situational penalty die caused by environmental conditions (low gravity, radiation exposure, extreme cold, pressure instability, or similar). This does not negate damage or long-term effects—only momentary operational difficulty.
etiquette_high_society_desc-u: TODO: add description for etiquette (High Society)
everyday_carry_desc-u: Concealed storage clothing, a few practical tools, emergency cash, and items chosen to blend in rather than stand out.
faded_token_of_past-u: A faded token of your past — half a locket, melted ID chip, or tattoo burned into new skin
family_connection_desc-u: A relative or sponsor still embedded in wealth or influence, cautious but reachable.
family_relic_desc-u: An object tied to your background: signet, archive key, inherited data shard, or symbolic marker of standing.
fellow_believer_desc-u: Still committed, quietly doubtful, or secretly afraid, but tied to the same belief system you came from.
fellow_nomad_desc-u: A person who understands the rhythm of leaving and knows when not to ask why.
fellow_survivor_desc-u: Someone who escaped the same collapse and understands what you don’t say out loud.
fence_desc-u: Specializes in moving illegal goods quickly and quietly.
field_analysis_tools_desc-u: Measuring instruments, sample containers, documentation gear, and compact diagnostic equipment suited for on-site investigation.
first_aid_desc-u: TODO: add description for first aid
fixer_desc-u: Knows who is hiring, who is hunting, and what things are worth today.
flaw_addiction_major_description-u: If you go without it for a full scene, you suffer –10% to Willpower and Insight checks until you dose again.
flaw_addiction_major_flavor-u: You rely on a drug, stim, or neuro-chemical regulator to stay functional.
flaw_addiction_minor_description-u: If you go without it for a full scene, you suffer –10% to Willpower and Insight checks until you dose again.
flaw_addiction_minor_flavor-u: You rely on a drug, stim, or neuro-chemical regulator to stay functional.
flaw_blood_debt_description-u: At any time, the GM may invoke your debt, requiring you to: • Accept a mission or task • Surrender a resource or ally • Stay silent or lie on their behalf. Refusal may result in retaliation, burned Contacts, or pursuit.
flaw_blood_debt_flavor-u: You owe something dangerous—House, syndicate, or worse.
flaw_compulsive_gambler_description-u: When offered a gamble, criminal shortcut, or dangerous windfall, roll Willpower. On failure, you must pursue it—no matter the odds.
flaw_compulsive_gambler_flavor-u: You can’t walk away from a high-risk reward.
flaw_cyber_rejection_description-u: You cannot install Restricted or Illegal cyberware without suffering +50% Vitality cost and high risk of rejection (GM discretion).
flaw_distinctive_look_description-u: Tattoos, implants, aura, scars—something about you stands out. Anyone attempting to recognize or remember you gains +10% to relevant checks, and you cannot benefit from Flaws or effects that conceal identity (e.g., Forgettable Presence).
flaw_hex_stained_description-u: Once per scene, when using arcanotech or sustaining a spell, the GM may call for a roll to resist device malfunction, magical backlash, or short-circuiting your gear.
flaw_hex_stained_flavor-u: Arcane systems and sustained magic react poorly to your body.
flaw_hunted_description-u: Once per session, the GM may introduce a threat, warning, ambush, or hostile interference from your pursuer.
flaw_hunted_flavor-u: Someone is actively searching for you—and they have power.
flaw_marked_by_the_black_description-u: Spirits may fear, follow, or confront you unprovoked. Arcane wards treat you as hostile. Any spell or spirit effect with sensing components always detects your presence.
flaw_marked_by_the_black_flavor-u: You bear a Veil corruption sigil or metaphysical scar.
flaw_mental_scar_description-u: When exposed to your trigger (e.g., fire, blood, tight spaces), the GM may trigger a panic, freeze, or hallucination. You may resist with a Willpower check. This occurs at least once per session if thematically possible.
flaw_mental_scar_flavor-u: A trauma still bleeds into your present.
flaw_soul_flare_description-u: Once per scene, when you cast a spell or are targeted by one, the GM may call for a 1d10 roll. On a 1, the spell surges, fizzles, or causes backlash, at GM discretion.
flaw_soul_flare_flavor-u: Your magical signature is unstable—chaotic and unpredictable.
flaw_veil_touched_description-u: Spirits detect you easily, arcane wards may misfire near you, and Veil-sensitive technology always flags your presence.
flaw_veil_touched_flavor-u: You’ve been altered by the Veil—just enough to be noticed.
flaw_wanted_low_priority_description-u: Once per session, the GM may introduce a checkpoint, surveillance conflict, or bounty interference linked to your record.
flaw_wanted_low_priority_flavor-u: You’re flagged in some system—corp registry, street watchlist, or local bounty net.
flee-in-panic-da-dec2: When the investigator comes to their senses they are far away, perhaps lost in the wilderness or hammering on a door demanding to be let inside.
flee-in-panic-dec: The investigator is compelled to get as far away as possible by whatever means are available.
flee-in-panic-dec2: When the investigator comes to their senses they are far away.
forbidden_lore_desc-u: TODO: add description for forbidden lore
former_colleague_desc-u: A fellow researcher who stayed in the field, shifted careers, or now works somewhere with resources you no longer have.
former_crew_member_desc-u: Someone who survived the same Offworld posting and understands the kind of trouble you don’t talk about.
former_partner_desc-u: Still active, retired, or burned like you, but they know how enforcement really works and who can be trusted.
fringe_fixer_desc-u: Knows how to get things quietly, move people discreetly, and avoid attention where authority is thin.
fringe_mobility_gear_desc-u: Durable clothing, climbing aids, weather protection, and lightweight travel equipment suited for rough terrain and long movement.
go_bag_desc-u: Lightweight pack containing preserved food, water filtration, emergency shelter materials, and basic medical supplies.
harness_rig-u: A tattered harness rig or reinforced tail-wrap, pieced together from scrap and survival
head: Head
heavy_weapons_desc-u: TODO: add description for heavy weapons
hidden_cache_marker_desc-u: Coordinates, tags, or encoded directions leading to a small stashed supply or safe spot somewhere in the Fringe.
hidden_doctrine_cache_desc-u: Encrypted writings, coded prayers, memory shards, or forbidden teachings preserved from your past.
ideology-beliefs-dec: Review the investigator’s backstory entry for Ideology and Beliefs. The investigator manifests one of these in an extreme, crazed and demonstrative manner.
influencer_rig_desc-u: Personal presentation gear, branded or anonymized accounts, and tools for rapid dissemination.
info_broker_desc-u: Trades in rumors, leaks, and half-confirmed stories before they become public.
infrastructure_tech_desc-u: Specializes in power, water, transit, or environmental systems and knows where the weak points are.
institutional_liaison_desc-u: A bureaucrat, professor, or administrator who understands how to navigate academic or research systems—legally or otherwise.
institutionalized-dec: The investigator comes to their senses in a psychiatric ward or police cell. They may slowly recall the events that led them there.
keep_moving_desc-u: Once per session, when you fail a roll while escaping danger, enduring harsh conditions, or pushing through exhaustion, you may immediately reroll the check and must keep the new result. If the reroll succeeds, the action still carries a cost chosen by the GM, such as lost time, expended resources, increased visibility, strain, or leaving evidence behind.
keepsake_relic_desc-u: A personal object from somewhere you left behind. It has no mechanical value, but may carry emotional weight, proof, or leverage.
kin_token-u: A kin-token — an encoded charm recognized only by those raised in Veilhaven tradition
known_quantity_desc-u: Once per session, when dealing with criminals, fixers, or black-market actors, you may treat yourself as a known, vetted operator rather than an unknown variable. The GM must frame the initial reaction as cautious but open rather than hostile or dismissive. A roll may still be required, but you are not starting from zero.
labor_fixer_desc-u: Arranges work, cover jobs, or access through unofficial industrial channels.
legacy_ritual_item-u: A ritual item linked to your inherited mask — an old ring, favored scent vial, or memory-laced token
libraryuse_desc-u: TODO: add description for library use
mania-dec: The investigator gains a new mania. Roll 1D100 on Sample Manias Table (or choose one). The investigator seeks to indulge in their new mania.
mania-dec2: The investigator gains a new mania. Roll 1D100 on Manias Table or choose one. The investigator comes to their senses (1D10) hours later. During this bout of madness, the investigator will have been fully indulging in their new mania. Whether this is apparent to other people is up to the Keeper and player.
mark_of_the_faithful_desc-u: A visible or concealed symbol, scar, implant, or token that identifies you to those who know what to look for.
mask_journal-u: A mask journal - pages filled with early personas, sketches, and encoded emotional notes.
melee_weapons_desc-u: TODO: add description for melee weapons
middle_manager_desc-u: Knows procedures, bottlenecks, and who to bribe to move things quietly.
modded_wearable-u: or a modded wearable passed down, built, or looted during your youth
natural_world_desc-u: TODO: add description for natural world
neighborhood_fixer_desc-u: Knows who owes favors, who can be leaned on, and who to avoid altogether.
neural_interface_plug-u: A salvaged neural interface plug or encrypted pocket drive filled with fragments of broken AI code.
oathbreakers_kin_oathstone-u: A broken oath-stone or defaced emblem—kept not as shame, but as reminder.
occult_lore_desc-u: TODO: add description for occult lore
old_crew_contact_desc-u: A former associate who knows your history and what lines you won’t cross.
outpost_keepsake-u: A keepsake from your outpost — an old revolver, patched cloak, or radio etched with prayercode
performance_archive_desc-u: A private file of reports, evaluations, and internal memos that can be referenced to establish credibility—or leverage.
perk_blood_born_survivor_description-u: You begin play with +2 bonus HP. Once per scene, when reduced to 0 HP, you may take one final action before collapsing. You fall unconscious immediately afterward.
perk_combat_veteran_description-u: Once per session, you may perform a free Dodge or Fight back reaction, even if you've already used your Reaction this round.
perk_combat_veteran_flavor-u: You've survived worse. You don’t flinch—you move.
perk_corp_groomed_description-u: Gain +10% to Etiquette and Deception when interacting with corporate or House-affiliated NPCs. Once per session, you may request a minor favor or make a connection through your network (GM discretion applies).
perk_corp_groomed_flavor-u: You know the language of power—and how to speak it.
perk_danger_sense_description-u: Gain +10% to Perception checks made to detect ambushes, traps, or hidden threats. Once per session, you may reroll your Initiative roll and take the second result.
perk_danger_sense_flavor-u: You feel tension before it breaks.
perk_dirty_fighter_description-u: Once per scene, when making a melee attack against a target already engaged with another character, you deal an additional +1d4 damage.
perk_dirty_fighter_flavor-u: You strike when the other guy isn’t looking.
perk_forgettable_presence_description-u: In populated or low-focus environments, others have +1 difficulty to recall your face, clothing, or description. You also gain +10% to Stealth checks made in crowded or urban areas. This effect is nullified if you possess obvious cyberware, tattoos, or notable fashion.
perk_forgettable_presence_flavor-u: You vanish into crowds and conversations like smoke.
perk_linguist_description-u: Choose one additional language. You are natively fluent and literate in both your primary and secondary languages. This allows you to operate in multicultural or coded environments without penalty.
perk_linguist_flavor-u: You speak like you were born in two places.
perk_mind_leash_description-u: Once per session, you may automatically resist one effect that would cause fear, possession, mental control, or arcane suppression. You must be conscious and aware of the attempt.
perk_mind_leash_flavor-u: Your will doesn’t just hold—it locks shut.
perk_photographic_recall_description-u: Gain +10% to all Memory checks, and you may recall minor details of previously observed environments, documents, or audio with near-perfect accuracy at the GM’s discretion.
perk_photographic_recall_flavor-u: You never forget what you see.
perk_resilient_frame_description-u: Increase your maximum HP by +4. This is a permanent enhancement representing durable physiology, dense muscle, or uncanny endurance.
perk_scorched_soul_description-u: Gain +10% to resist magical fear, hallucinations, and psychic trauma, including effects caused by Veil exposure, supernatural dread, or arcane-induced madness.
perk_scorched_soul_flavor-u: You've endured something that would break most minds.
perk_shadow_mark_description-u: You carry a Veil sigil or spiritual stain that spirits recognize. Gain Advantage when dealing with spirits or navigating Veil zones. Some entities may fear you. Others may pursue you.
perk_shadow_mark_flavor-u: Something from the other side remembers you.
perk_tactical_instinct_description-u: Once per session, you act first in Initiative order for the first round of combat, regardless of your Initiative result. After that round, normal Initiative resumes.
perk_tactical_instinct_flavor-u: You see the opening before anyone else even moves.
perk_veil_drenched_intuition_description: Once per session, you may ask the GM a yes/no question about the current scene, NPC, or mission. The answer is vague, symbolic, or intuitive—but always true.
perk_veil_drenched_intuition_flavor-u: Something in you dreams the truth before it happens.
personal_sidearm_package_desc-u: A legally registered or discreetly unregistered sidearm with spare magazines and carry gear.
personal_stash_desc-u: A small hidden cache containing supplies, a weapon-sized space, or valuable items placed somewhere only you know how to reach.
personal_survival_kit-u: A personal survival kit — lock bypass tool, emergency stim, or burner credential chip
phobia-dec: The investigator gains a new phobia. Roll 1D100 on Sample Phobias Table (or choose one). Even if the source of the phobia is not present, the investigator imagines it is there.
phobia-dec2: The investigator gains a new phobia. Roll 1D100 on Phobias Table or choose one. The investigator comes to their senses (1D10) hours later, having taken every precaution to avoid their new phobia.
physical-hysterics-or-emotional-outburst: The investigator is incapacitated from laughing, crying, screaming, etc.
press_credentials_desc-u: Legitimate, expired, or forged access credentials that still open doors in the right situations.
pristine_id_code_uptier_zone-u: A pristine ID code from your original home zone, and access to a 15 XP Ally or Contact
private_security_handler_desc-u: Works for a corporation or contractor that values experience over paperwork and understands deniable operations.
protective_gear_desc-u: Reinforced gloves, respirator, eye protection, and industrial clothing that justify limited protection in hazardous environments.
psychosomatic-disability-dec: The investigator suffers psychosomatic blindness, deafness, or loss of the use of a limb or limbs.
pulp-alter-ego-dec: The hero’s personality undergoes a complete transformation and is replaced by one completely different. The alter ego is a mirror opposite of the hero.
pulp-amnesia-dec: The hero ceases to think of him or herself as a hero, losing the ability to use his or her pulp talents.
pulp-amnesia-dec2: The hero comes to their senses in some unfamiliar place, with no memory of who they are and lacking any of their pulp talents. Their memories slowly return to them over time. Their pulp talents only return in a time of crisis. In this case, a crisis is defined as someone’s life being endangered. When someone’s life is threatened, the hero should make a Luck roll; if successful, their talents return. If unsuccessful they may try again in 1D10 rounds.
pulp-battered-dec: The hero comes to their senses (1D10) hours later to find themselves battered and bruised. Hit points are reduced to half of what they were before going insane. They have not been robbed. How the damage was sustained is up to the Keeper.
pulp-crazy-plan-dec: The hero pursues an irrational or ill-conceived plan. The plan must either benefit the enemy’s situation or increase the danger for the hero or his or her allies.
pulp-flee-in-panic-dec: The hero is compelled to get as far away as possible by whatever means are available, even if it necessitates them taking the only vehicle and leaving everyone else behind.
pulp-flee-in-panic-dec2: When the hero comes to their senses, they are far away, perhaps somewhere noteworthy or lost. How they reached the location is unknown to them.
pulp-gloat-dec: The hero is compelled to boast, gloat, or exclaim their plans aloud.
pulp-ideology-beliefs-dec: Review the hero’s backstory entry for Ideology and Beliefs. The hero manifests one of these in an extreme, crazed, and demonstrative manner. A common outcome is some variant of megalomania, whereby the hero’s talents and beliefs begin to corrupt their humanity and sense of right and wrong.
pulp-institutionalized-or-apprehended-de: The hero comes to their senses in a high-security psychiatric ward, police cell or under captivity. They may slowly recall the events that led them there.
pulp-mania-dec: The hero gains a new mania. Roll 1D100 on Sample Manias Table (or choose one). The hero seeks to indulge in their new mania.
pulp-mania-dec2: The hero gains a new mania. Roll 1D100 on Manias Table or choose one. The hero comes to their senses (1D10) hours later. During this bout of madness, they will have been fully indulging in their new mania. Whether this is apparent to other people is up to the Keeper and player.
pulp-phobia-dec: The hero gains a new phobia. Roll 1D100 on Sample Phobias Table (or choose one). Even if the source of the phobia is not present, the hero imagines it is there.
pulp-phobia-dec2: The hero gains a new phobia. Roll 1D100 on Phobias Table or choose one. The hero comes to their senses (1D10) hours later, having taken every precaution to avoid their new phobia.
pulp-rage-dec: A red mist descends on the hero and he or she explodes in a spree of uncontrolled violence and destruction directed at their surroundings, allies, or foes alike.
pulp-relax-dec: The hero is convinced that the threat is negligible, and he or she sits back and relaxes.
pulp-robbed-dec: The hero comes to their senses (1D10) hours later, having been robbed. They are unharmed. If they were carrying a Treasured Possession (per their backstory), make a Luck roll to see if it was stolen. Everything else of value is automatically missing.
pulp-show-off-dec: The hero becomes an attention-seeking maniac, possibly prone to foolhardy acts.
pulp-significant-people-dec: Consult the hero’s backstory entry for Significant People and why the relationship is so important. In the time that passes (1D10 hours or more) the hero has done their best to get close to that person and act upon their relationship in some way.
pulp-violence-dec2: The hero explodes in a spree of violence and destruction. When the hero comes to their senses, their actions may or may not be apparent or remembered. Who or what the hero has inflicted violence upon, and whether they have killed or only inflicted harm, is up to the Keeper.
racial_alteri_fixed_tell_rules-u:
No Alteri transformation is flawless. Each Alteri possesses a Fixed Tell: a subtle, immutable detail that persists across all forms. This may be a recurring vocal resonance, an unnatural stillness of the eyes, a faint but consistent scent, or another small inconsistency that resists change.

Rules:
You must define one Fixed Tell at character creation. This detail persists across all forms and cannot be removed or concealed by any means. In situations where a character deliberately scrutinizes you, suspects deception, or possesses relevant knowledge, the GM may grant a bonus die on checks made to identify you beneath a disguise. This feature never causes automatic discovery, but it always provides a plausible avenue for exposure.
racial_alteri_shifting_form_rules-u:
Alteri possess a mutable physiology that allows them to physically reshape their body and voice to resemble another humanoid of similar size and structure. This transformation is biological rather than illusory: flesh alters, bone shifts, and vocal structure reconfigures. To most observers, an Alteri does not appear disguised—they appear real.

Rules:
You may physically assume the appearance and voice of any broadly humanoid ancestry or individual of comparable size. This does not alter your statistics, equipment, cyberware, credentials, or social authority, and does not grant knowledge or access you do not possess. Shifting Form is governed by detailed rules covering timing, Strain costs, scrutiny, and identity management; see Appendix: Alteri Masks & Shifting.
racial_alteri_social_calibration_rules-u:
Alteri are trained to sense when their presence, behavior, or presentation does not align with the social rhythm of a space. Through subconscious attention to posture, timing, tone, and reaction, they recognize instability before it becomes overt conflict.

Rules:
When you enter a sustained social interaction where your current identity, behavior, or presentation would plausibly create suspicion or instability, the GM must warn you before consequences escalate. This warning provides no mechanical benefit, reveals no intentions or solutions, and does not prevent consequences if you continue. It exists to prevent accidental escalation, not deliberate risk.
racial_alteri_true_morphology_rules-u:
Alteri transformations have mass, texture, breath, and physical presence consistent with what they appear to be. Their altered form exists fully in the physical world rather than as a projected or arcane overlay.

Rules:
Your transformed form is not an illusion and cannot be dismissed, dispelled, or negated by effects that suppress or invalidate illusion magic. This does not protect you from physical inspection, biometric analysis, or magic designed to analyze altered bodies rather than illusions. This feature establishes plausibility under scrutiny; it does not confer immunity.
racial_draevi_grounded_awareness_rules-u:
Draevi do not observe the world from a distance. They feel it through posture, vibration, airflow, and pressure. A Draevi knows when something is wrong not because they see it, but because the environment stops behaving as it should.

Rules:
Once per session, when you are in a physical environment with coherent terrain, structure, or natural flow, you may ask the GM whether an unseen environmental shift is occurring that would reasonably be noticeable to someone attuned to the space. The GM must answer truthfully, but vaguely. This may include approaching movement, structural instability, sudden unnatural stillness, or changes in crowd or wildlife behavior. This trait does not identify causes, threats, or intentions, and it does not function against purely digital, abstract, or fully arcane phenomena.
racial_draevi_marked_by_memory_rules-u:
Draevi culture records identity through the body. Tattoos, scarification, and ritual markings are testimony: proof of survival, oath, and transformation. These marks are visible, distinctive, and culturally significant—and difficult to hide without denying who you are.

Rules:
You must define at least one visible marking that reflects a significant event or truth in your past. This marking cannot be fully concealed without deliberate effort and appropriate clothing or disguise. In social or cultural contexts where Draevi traditions are known, this mark may invite recognition, expectation, or judgment. The GM is encouraged to treat these markings as narrative leverage rather than a benefit, especially when anonymity, neutrality, or denial would otherwise apply. This feature never causes automatic failure or forces disclosure; it exists to create persistent narrative pressure rather than impose mechanical penalties.
racial_draevi_primal_endurance_rules-u:
Draevi bodies are shaped by travel, exposure, and lean seasons. Their endurance is not immunity, but persistence—the ability to keep functioning through hardship that would force others to stop.

Rules:
Once per session, when you would suffer fatigue, environmental strain, or a lingering condition caused by weather, terrain, illness, or deprivation, you may delay the onset of that effect until the end of the scene. This does not negate damage, negate magical effects, or remove consequences; it allows you to function briefly through hardship before it catches up to you.
racial_draevi_surefooted_motion_rules-u:
Draevi movement is instinctive and economical. Whether crossing loose scree, broken infrastructure, or unstable elevation, they adjust without hesitation. Their balance is not careful; it is unconscious.

Rules:
When movement through unstable or hazardous terrain would impose a penalty, cost extra time, or force a balance check, you may treat the terrain as manageable for the purpose of repositioning, climbing, or crossing. This does not grant increased speed, prevent falls caused by external force, or negate deliberate sabotage.

Once per scene, if you fail a movement-related check, you may immediately reposition to nearby safe footing instead of suffering a fall or similar escalation.
racial_feran_natural_weapons_rules-u: Feran increase the damage die of their unarmed attacks by one step (e.g., from 1d3 to 1d4, or 1d4 to 1d6). This applies only to natural unarmed attacks, not melee weapons or cybernetic replacements.
racial_feran_night_honed_vision_rules-u: Feran ignore all penalties for dim or low-light environments. They suffer standard penalties in complete darkness unless assisted by external light, cyberware, or spells.
racial_feran_pack_instinct_rules-u: Once per scene, as a Reaction, a Feran may grant an ally within Short Range a bonus die on one Dodge check. This bonus must be declared before the roll.
racial_feran_predator_reflexes_rules-u: Once per session, a Feran may reroll a failed Dodge or Coordination check. Alternatively, they may spend 2 Strain to gain a bonus die on either roll before attempting it.
racial_feran_wallrunners_grace_rules-u: Feran gain a bonus die on all Climb checks and may ignore movement penalties from unstable or narrow terrain. In addition, they take half damage from falling.
racial_human_act_before_it_settles_rules:
Humans move before certainty arrives. When danger escalates, plans fracture, or a situation shifts from controlled to volatile, Humans tend to act on instinct rather than waiting for clarity. This does not make them smarter than others. It makes them earlier.

Rules:
Once per session, when Initiative is about to be rolled or when a scene escalates from tension into open conflict, you may immediately take one Maneuver before the first Initiative order resolves. This Maneuver cannot be an Attack or Cast, but may be used to reposition, draw equipment, take cover, issue a warning, or interact with an unsecured object. This does not replace or delay your normal turn.
racial_human_fail_forward_rules-u:
Humans are not immune to failure. They simply refuse to let it be the end of the story. When something goes wrong, they improvise, adapt, and push the outcome sideways instead of stopping cold.

Rules:
Once per session, when you fail a skill check, you may choose to force partial progress instead of stalling. The attempt does not cleanly succeed; instead, it produces an unstable or compromised outcome that advances the situation while introducing immediate cost. You immediately suffer 1d4 Strain, and the result of the action is treated as incomplete, risky, or short-lived in a way that follows directly from how you pushed it through. This feature cannot be used on attack rolls, cannot negate consequences already resolved, and cannot turn failure into a clean success.
racial_human_push_through_rules-u:
Humans keep functioning past the point where others would break. Pain, fear, shock, and exhaustion slow them down, but they do not stop them outright. What they ignore in the moment always comes due later.

Rules:
Once per session, when you would be prevented from taking an Action or Maneuver on your turn due to pain, shock, fear, exhaustion, or similar pressure short of Incapacitation, you may act anyway. You take your turn normally, ignoring that restriction for this turn only. At the end of your turn, you immediately suffer 1d6 Strain. This feature does not allow you to act if you are Incapacitated, unconscious, or otherwise completely unable to function, and it does not remove or negate any conditions affecting you.
racial_human_reputation_for_trouble_rule:
Humans develop reputations by acting first and dealing with consequences later. Their choices leave impressions, stories, and loose ends that travel faster than they do. Even when their actions succeed, they are rarely forgotten.

Rules:
When you force momentum through early action, reckless commitment, or improvisation under pressure, the outcome tends to linger. People remember your involvement, environments show signs of your passage, and situations rarely close cleanly behind you. In scenes where past actions, unresolved consequences, or recognizable behavior patterns matter, the GM may treat you as already known, suspected, or associated with trouble, even if you were not formally identified at the time. This does not grant automatic failure, impose fixed penalties, or override successful disguises or preparations. Instead, it establishes that your presence carries narrative weight: doors may open with caution, questions may come earlier, and opportunities may arrive wrapped in expectation rather than trust. This reputation is not uniform. Some see you as capable. Others see you as dangerous. Many see you as both.
racial_khadra_natural_armor_rules-u: Khadra receive 1 point of Damage Reduction against all non-magical physical attacks. This stacks with worn armor but does not apply to magical, elemental, or psychic damage unless otherwise noted.
racial_khadra_oathweight_presence_rules-: Once per scene, a Khadra may gain a bonus die on any Intimidate or Persuade check when invoking an oath, promise, or standing in defense of another. This ability cannot be used for deception.
racial_khadra_stonebound_endurance_rules: Once per session, a Khadra may reduce physical damage taken from a single source by 1d6 (declared after damage is rolled). Additionally, they gain a bonus die on Constitution rolls to resist fatigue, poison, or environmental effects.
racial_khadra_unshaken_resolve_rules-u: Once per session, a Khadra may automatically succeed on a Willpower roll made to resist fear, panic, magical coercion, or emotional manipulation.
racial_khadra_weight_of_stone_rules-u: Once per round, as a reaction to being targeted by an attack or forced-movement effect, a Khadra may activate Weight of Stone. Until the end of the round, they gain +2 Damage Reduction against physical attacks. If the triggering effect would move them, they may roll Constitution with a bonus die to resist being pushed, pulled, or knocked prone.
racial_kitsu_cyber_mystic_synergy_rules-: During character creation, a Kitsu may choose any two skills from: Slicing, Electronics, Magic (Illusion), Magic (Enchantment), Magic (Alteration), or Stealth. They gain a +10% bonus to each, reflecting early mastery of their hybrid tradition.
racial_kitsu_cyber_spirit_instinct_rules: Kitsu gain a bonus die on Perception checks made to detect active surveillance, hidden technology, or ambient magical anomalies. Once per session, they may ask the GM: "Is something in this space hidden or watching me?" The GM must answer truthfully, though vaguely.
racial_kitsu_fox_eared_reflexes_rules-u: Once per session, a Kitsu may reroll a failed Dodge or Coordination check. Alternatively, by spending 2 Strain, they may gain a bonus die to the roll instead, chosen before the check is made.
racial_kitsu_mask_of_the_foxfire_rules-u: Once per session, a Kitsu may reroll a failed Charm, Deception, or Stealth check if the action involves disguise, trickery, or misdirection. If the context involves Illusion or Enchantment magic, they instead gain a bonus die on the roll.
racial_kitsu_strain_the_moment_rules-u: Once per session, a Kitsu may take one reaction for free, even if they have already used a reaction this round. If that reaction is Dodge, it also gains a bonus die. This free reaction costs no Strain and does not count toward the normal limit.
racial_lyranni_resonant_mind_rules-u:
Lyranni minds are shaped by generations of arcane exposure. Patterns surface more easily. Symbols connect faster. Where others struggle to interpret magical residue or ritual logic, the Lyranni recognize familiar tension in unfamiliar forms.

Rules:
Once per session, after failing a roll to interpret, analyze, or recall information related to magic, ritual, or Veil phenomena, you may immediately reroll the check. You must take the new result. This feature does not apply to casting spells, resisting magical effects, or modifying spell outcomes.
racial_lyranni_ritual_poise_rules-u:
Legacy lingers in how the Lyranni speak, move, and pause. Their composure carries weight in spaces shaped by tradition, ceremony, or ideological conflict. Whether invoking ancient etiquette or quietly defying it, they understand how ritual influences perception.

Rules:
Once per session, when you fail a Charm, Performance, or Etiquette check in a formal, ceremonial, or culturally significant context, you may reroll the check and keep the new result. This feature does not override active opposition, expose deception, or force compliance; it establishes composure and credibility rather than control.
racial_lyranni_veil_attunement_rules-u:
The Veil is not distant to the Lyranni. It presses close, felt as pressure, warmth, or unease long before it manifests openly. Even without spellcasting, most Lyranni learn to recognize when the world is no longer behaving naturally.

Rules:
Once per session, you may ask the GM whether arcane, spiritual, or Veil-based influence is present in the current scene. The GM must answer truthfully, but vaguely, indicating presence, intensity, or proximity only. This feature does not identify sources, spells, effects, intentions, or methods, and does not replace investigation or analysis.
racial_lyranni_veil_sensitivity_rules-u:
The Veil does not sit evenly around the Lyranni. Its shifts, fractures, and instabilities register in their bodies long before they become visible or disruptive. Where others experience a Veil event as a sudden intrusion, Lyranni often feel it approaching—like a change in pressure before a storm. How this sensitivity manifests varies from individual to individual. Some experience headaches, vertigo, or nosebleeds. Others feel nausea, heat behind the eyes, trembling hands, emotional unease, or a subtle distortion in perception. A few describe it as an ache in old scars, a ringing in the ears, or the sense that something nearby is out of alignment. Whatever the form, the sensation is unmistakable once learned.

Rules:
When the local Veil state is unstable, strained, thinning, or actively changing—such as near rifts, fractures, breaches, ritual disturbances, or heavily Veil-saturated environments—the GM may describe physical or sensory discomfort affecting you. This sensation does not identify the source, location, cause, or intent of the disturbance, and it never provides tactical detail or automatic warning. It exists to signal that the Veil is no longer behaving normally. Veil Sensitivity never causes automatic failure and does not impose fixed mechanical penalties by default. Instead, it creates persistent sensory pressure that may complicate concentration, rest, social composure, or prolonged exposure at the GM’s discretion. Appropriate preparation, distance, shielding, or removal from the affected area can reduce or eliminate these effects. This sensitivity is constant but uneven. Over time, most Lyranni learn to recognize their own tells—but they can never fully ignore them.
racial_veyra_quietstep_rules-u: Once per scene, you may reroll a Stealth check and take the better result. If both rolls succeed, treat the result as one tier higher (Success becomes Hard, Hard becomes Extreme, etc.). This ability may only be used when attempting to move silently or avoid detection—not when hiding in plain sight.
racial_veyra_sensitive_to_light_rules-u: In brightly lit environments (including daylight or exposed white-lumen interiors), you suffer a –10% penalty to Perception, Ranged Attacks, and Stealth unless wearing protective goggles or filters. This penalty does not apply in dim or ambient light conditions.
racial_veyra_tech_instinct_rules-u: You gain a +10% bonus to Mechanics and Electronics rolls when working with unfamiliar or improvised devices. This bonus still applies if the device is broken, unmarked, proprietary, or alien in origin. Additionally, you may spend one uninterrupted minute examining any non-magical technological device. At the end of that minute, choose Mechanics, Electronics, or INT (your choice, depending on the device). On a success, you determine the device’s function and current state. On a Hard success, you may operate or bypass it as if trained, even without formal access or instruction.
racial_veyra_tinkers_touch_rules-u: You may attempt basic mechanical repairs or electronic bypasses without proper tools, suffering no penalty for improvised kits. In addition, when crafting, customizing, or modifying a device, reduce the time required by half. This does not apply to magical devices or arcanotech unless you have the relevant skills.
racial_veyra_ultrasonic_perception_rules: You can perceive your environment in total darkness within Short range through echolocation and ultrasonic sensing. This allows you to locate creatures, structures, and moving objects—even through thin walls—though you cannot perceive fine color, text, or illusion-based visuals this way. You are immune to blindness caused by darkness unless you are both deafened and disoriented.
ram_shell_unfinished-u: A partially bonded RAM shell or unfinished familiar — a spirit-chassis waiting for purpose.
read_the_room_desc-u: Once per session, when entering a tense social or public situation, you may ask the GM one of the following questions: Who here is most dangerous right now? or What unspoken rule matters most in this space? The answer reflects immediate social reality rather than hidden secrets.
recording_kit_desc-u: Portable audio/video equipment, editing tools, and storage media suitable for fast turnaround work.
refuge_network_contact_desc-u: Knows safehouses, aid routes, and who still helps without asking questions.
repurposed_clan_token-u: A worn clan token, repurposed as jewelry or tech — a charm ring, clan-burned magplate, or old totem strung on copper wire.
research_go_bag_desc-u: Field notebooks (physical or digital), portable scanners, archival tools, reference chips, and basic preservation supplies.
response_loadout_desc-u: Tactical clothing, basic breach tools, and utility equipment retained or salvaged from service.
rite_of_passage_horn-u: A ritual token passed through clan hands — a horn etching, vine-bound charm, or ancestral tattoo woven into your skin.
ritual_implements_desc-u: Symbols, tools, texts, or objects used in ceremonies, rites, or observances, some legal, some questionable.
robbed-dec: The investigator comes to their senses (1D10) hours later, having been robbed. They are unharmed. If they were carrying a Treasured Possession, make a Luck roll to see if it was stolen. Everything else of value is automatically missing.
salvaged_veil_artifact-u: A salvaged artifact with emotional or experimental value—a Veil-scarred tool, shattered drone, or copper-burned talisman.
scavenger_guide_desc-u: An experienced pathfinder who knows which ruins are worth entering—and which ones kill the unprepared.
scent_marked_scrap-u: A scent-marked scrap of hide or charm from your first pack — still recognizable to those who knew you.
scrap_survival_kit_desc-u: Basic tools, repair tape, scavenged parts, water filtration, and emergency rations cobbled together from experience rather than manuals.
settlement_elder_or_organizer_desc-u: Someone who keeps a Fringe community functioning through favors, memory, and hard-earned trust.
shackled-da-dec: The investigator, raving and talking in strange tongues, has been captured and put in shackles or imprisoned in some manner.
shift_foreman_desc-u: Knows schedules, access points, and which corners are quietly ignored.
sigil_etched_blade-u: A sigil-etched blade, encoded pact-scroll, or badge of your crew lineage.
signal_mask-u: A patched-together signal mask or scav-harness wired with tools for low-crawl access.
significant-people-dec: Consult the investigator’s backstory entry for Significant People and why the relationship is so important. In the time that passes (1D10 hours or more) the investigator has done their best to get close to that person and act upon their relationship in some way.
significant-person-dec: The investigator mistakes another person in the scene for a Significant Person of theirs.
sleight_of_hand_desc-u: TODO: add description for sleight of hand
smuggler_or_guide_desc-u: Specializes in moving people quietly through dangerous or restricted zones.
social_fixer_desc-u: A broker of introductions, favors, and quiet corrections when reputations are at risk.
social_gravity_desc-u: Once per session, when you initiate a social or institutional interaction from a position of assumed authority or legitimacy, gain +1 bonus die on the first roll of that exchange. This does not apply to threats, coercion, or criminal negotiations.
specialized_reference_cache_desc-u: A curated collection of restricted texts, encrypted files, or recovered academic records tied to your area of study.
spot_hidden_desc-u: TODO: add description for spot hidden
station_tech_or_dockmaster_desc-u: Knows how to bend port rules, delay inspections, or get access to restricted infrastructure.
stonehold_ward_token-u: A carved stone amulet or ward-braided arm wrap, passed down by a senior keeper of your hold.
street_medic_or_fence_desc-u: Someone who patches people up or moves goods quietly, no questions asked.
symbolic_magitech_mod-u: A symbolic magitech mod—chroma filament, glow-ink, or data-vein etching (cosmetic only).
systems_toolkit_desc-u: Diagnostic tools, calibration equipment, spare components, and interface cables scavenged from Offworld infrastructure.
tailored_wardrobe_desc-u: High-quality clothing and accessories appropriate to elite environments, designed to project status and credibility.
talent_alteri_author_of_the_moment_rules: Type: Special Immediate (Narrative Control) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — During a sustained social interaction, declare one reasonable assumption about your role, presence, or relationship to the situation that has not yet been contradicted. For the remainder of the scene, neutral observers treat that assumption as true unless actively challenged or disproven. You gain +1 bonus die on the first roll made to act in accordance with that assumption.
talent_alteri_behavioral_study_rules-u: Type: Action (Observation) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — After a brief interaction or focused observation of a specific individual, you may attempt to prepare a Mask based on them. Make an Insight roll. On a Success, you may finalize the Mask without requiring a full scene of observation. If the subject is alert, guarded, or trained to resist scrutiny, this roll is opposed by their Willpower. On a Failure, a full scene of observation is still required.
