talent_alteri_biometric_plausibility_rul: Type: Passive (Impersonation Systems) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — When impersonating a specific individual or role, you may use Performance (Impersonation) in place of Slicing or Electronics to spoof non-hardened biometric systems such as facial recognition, voiceprint locks, gait analysis, or behavioral authentication. You gain +1 bonus die on Performance (Impersonation) rolls made to bypass such systems. This does not apply to hardened or multi-factor biometric security.
talent_alteri_compressed_observation_rul: Type: Passive (Study Acceleration) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — A brief interaction or short period of focused observation is always sufficient to attempt preparation of a Mask. On a Success, the Mask may be finalized immediately. On a Hard Success, the Mask does not suffer unfamiliarity penalties during its first scene of use.
talent_alteri_disciplined_morphology_rul: Type: Passive (Physiology) • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Through practice and internal control, you can extend your morphic limits beyond standard Alteri capability. When assuming a Mask, you may convincingly impersonate humanoid targets that are significantly larger or smaller than your natural form by altering tissue density, posture, and internal structure. This expands your plausible appearance range beyond your base size but does not change your Size stat, reach, damage, encumbrance, or physical capabilities.
talent_alteri_hardened_biometric_assimil: Type: Free Action (Persona Clone) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Flawlessly replicate a target’s full persona (appearance, mannerisms, tone); gain +1 bonus die to Disguise, Performance, or Deception checks tied to that impersonation.
talent_alteri_identity_saturation_rules-: Type: Passive (Cognitive Integration) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — When you first activate a prepared Mask in a scene, your instincts and habitual responses immediately align with that identity. Once per scene, you may treat one failed Performance (Impersonation), Deception, or Etiquette roll made while operating under that Mask as a Success instead of a Failure.
talent_alteri_immaculate_impersonation_r: Type: Passive (Identity Authority) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you activate a prepared Mask of a specific individual, neutral and friendly observers and non-hostile systems accept you as the legitimate individual for the duration of the scene unless presented with direct, compelling contradiction or incontrovertible proof. You gain +1 bonus die on Performance (Impersonation), Deception, and Etiquette rolls made to sustain this identity. This does not override prior personal familiarity or systems designed to verify genetic identity.
talent_alteri_institutional_passing_rule: Type: Passive (Systemic Plausibility) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — While operating under a prepared Mask, routine institutional interactions such as basic credential checks, informal questioning, and low-level access control treat you as legitimate unless the system or personnel are actively alerted, hostile, or operating under heightened security. This does not bypass formal verification, insider recognition, or systems designed to detect altered physiology.
talent_alteri_intent_mirroring_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Behavioral Echo) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When a character directs a clear social action toward you, such as asserting authority, probing familiarity, or applying pressure, you may mirror their intent through matching posture, cadence, and demeanor. Gain +1 bonus die to your next Insight, Deception, Persuade, or Performance (Impersonation) roll made directly in response.
talent_alteri_layered_identity_rules-u: Type: Passive (Identity Capacity) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — You may maintain two prepared Masks simultaneously. Switching between prepared Masks during an active scene requires an Action and costs 1d4 Strain. Outside of an active scene, switching between prepared Masks does not cost Strain. Only one Mask may be socially active at a time.
talent_alteri_living_mask_archive_rules-: Type: Passive (Identity Capacity) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will / 1/Session — You may maintain up to four prepared Masks simultaneously. Outside of active scenes, you may switch freely between prepared Masks without cost. Once per session, you may switch to any prepared Mask during a scene without spending an Action or Strain, provided the transition is plausibly supported by the environment or social context.
talent_alteri_maskwrights_grace_rules-u: Type: Passive (Aptitude) • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Choose one: +10% to Disguise, Insight, or Performance (Impersonation). (Once only.)
talent_alteri_perfect_adaptation_rules-u: Type: Passive (Behavioral Mastery) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you enter a scene under a prepared Mask, choose one social domain relevant to that identity, such as authority, familiarity, subservience, professionalism, or anonymity. For the rest of the scene, you are treated as naturally fluent in that domain. Once during the scene, you may treat one failed Performance (Impersonation), Deception, Persuade, or Etiquette roll tied to that domain as a Success instead of a Failure.
talent_alteri_plausible_existence_rules-: Type: Passive (Assumption) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — While acting within the expected role, behavior, and social position of your current Mask, neutral observers and non-alert systems treat your presence as legitimate by default unless they possess a concrete reason to doubt you. This does not override active investigations, formal verification, direct contradictions, or known hostile intelligence.
talent_alteri_predictive_empathy_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Behavioral Forecast) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Choose a character you are directly interacting with and make an Insight roll. On a Success, you may determine that character’s most likely behavioral approach in the next exchange, such as pressing, withdrawing, testing authority, seeking reassurance, or attempting deception. On a Hard Success, you also gain +1 bonus die to the first roll you make that directly exploits this expectation.
talent_alteri_seamless_transition_rules-: Type: Special Immediate (Identity Shift) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — You may switch to a prepared Mask without consuming an Action, provided the transition is supported by plausible movement, environmental cover, or social interruption. This does not prevent scrutiny if the transition itself would be implausible within the situation.
talent_alteri_second_skin_rules-u: Type: Passive (Identity) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — You may maintain one additional Mask beyond your default identity. Switching Masks requires an Action and costs 1d4 Strain when performed during an active scene or situation. Outside of an active scene, switching Masks does not cost Strain.
talent_alteri_shaped_for_subtlety_rules-: Type: Passive (Aptitude) • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Choose one: +10% to Stealth, Slicing, or Insight. (Once only.)
talent_alteri_social_attunement_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Assessment) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Choose a character you are directly interacting with and make an Insight roll. On a Success, you learn the general social expectations they have of you in the interaction, such as authority, familiarity, distance, or formality. On a Hard Success, you also learn one behavioral adjustment that would improve alignment with those expectations.
talent_alteri_social_blind_spot_rules-u: Type: Passive (Cognitive Absence) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — While operating under a prepared Mask in a contextually appropriate setting, casual observers do not form strong or lasting impressions of you. Minor inconsistencies or forgettable details do not escalate scrutiny unless reinforced by direct contradiction, repeated engagement, or external evidence. This does not affect targeted surveillance, dedicated tracking, or characters already actively focused on you.
talent_alteri_social_chameleon_rules-u: Type: Passive (Substitute) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — You may use Charm instead of Deception or Persuade when navigating unfamiliar cultures or coded social environments.
talent_alteri_social_null_field_rules-u: Type: Passive (Cognitive Absence) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — For the duration of a scene, your presence does not anchor attention or memory unless you take decisive or disruptive action. Casual observers struggle to recall your appearance, voice, or specific involvement once focus moves elsewhere. This does not affect targeted surveillance, active tracking, or characters already focused on you.
talent_draevi_body_like_the_road_rules-u: Type: Passive (Physiological Adaptation) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Gain +1 bonus die on CON rolls to resist poison, disease, spoiled food, and environmental toxins. If you fail such a roll, reduce any ongoing non-magical effect by one step in duration or severity. This does not negate magical poisons or supernatural afflictions.
talent_draevi_bound_to_the_old_paths_rul: Type: Special Immediate (Enduring Passage) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you lead a group through sustained movement, escape, or travel under pressure, affirm the route and press on. One failed Survival, Navigation, or movement-related roll made by you or an ally as part of that sequence is treated as a success, reflecting inherited route knowledge and practiced continuity rather than improvisation or speed.
talent_draevi_circle_of_the_standing_sto: Type: Action (Ancestral Perimeter) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — You establish a protective perimeter within Medium range centered on your current position by marking space through repetition, placement, and practiced movement tied to ancestral memory. While you remain within the perimeter, you and allies inside it gain +1 bonus die on rolls made to resist forced movement, disorientation, or environmental hazards. If you leave the perimeter, the effect immediately dissipates.
talent_draevi_claim_the_ground_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Anchoring Stance) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When you deliberately take position at the start of a scene or after a brief pause, designate your location as claimed ground. Until you leave it, you gain +1 bonus die on rolls to resist forced movement, knockdown, or environmental disruption. Allies within Short range gain +1 bonus die on the first roll they make to brace, stabilize, or reposition in that space.
talent_draevi_echoes_beneath_the_stone_r: Type: Free Action (Ancestral Guidance) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you pause in a location shaped by long use, travel, loss, or shared hardship, roll Spirit Lore. On a success, you receive symbolic impressions tied to what the place remembers. Your next roll made this scene that follows that guidance gains +1 bonus die.
talent_draevi_endure_the_long_walk_rules: Type: Special Immediate (Deferred Strain) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you would gain Strain, fatigue, or an environmental condition due to exposure, deprivation, weather, or sustained exertion, you may delay that effect until the end of the current scene. The effect is not negated and applies in full once the scene ends.
talent_draevi_eyes_of_the_pathkeeper_rul: Type: Free Action (Situational Read) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you pause to observe a physical space rather than act immediately, roll Perception or Survival. On a success, choose one: identify the safest route through the area, determine the most stable position to hold, or recognize signs of prior passage, habitation, or danger. Your next roll directly tied to that choice gains +1 bonus die.
talent_draevi_ground_remembers_me_rules-: Type: Free Action (Place Familiarity) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you remain in a location and act with deliberate presence, that space becomes familiar ground for the rest of the scene. While within it, you and allies within Short range gain +1 bonus die on rolls made to navigate, brace, hide, or reposition using the environment. The effect ends if the location is abandoned or radically altered.
talent_draevi_keeper_of_the_last_fire_ru: Type: Free Action (Sanctuary) • Cost: — • Usage: Resets after each Long Rest — When you establish a short or long rest in a location you have personally secured, sheltered, or deliberately chosen, you draw on shared custom and hard-earned routine to keep the group steady. You and one ally of your choice each recover 1d6 Strain at the end of that rest. In addition, during the rest, all First Aid and Medicine checks made to tend wounds or assist recovery for you or that ally gain +1 bonus die.
talent_draevi_lessons_carved_in_flesh_ru: Type: Passive (Adaptive Memory) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — When you face an environmental hazard, travel condition, or survival challenge you have previously endured during play, you gain +1 bonus die on the first roll you make to overcome it. If the situation would normally impose a penalty die, this bonus die instead cancels one such penalty.
talent_draevi_marks_of_the_road_rules-u: Type: Passive (Lived Memory) • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Choose one skill: Survival, Track, or Spirit Lore. When recalling routes, camps, hazards, land-bound rites, or lessons learned through travel or hardship, you gain +1 bonus die on checks using the chosen skill when lived experience is relevant.
talent_draevi_read_the_ground_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Pattern Recognition) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When entering or crossing a physical environment with coherent terrain or crowd flow, roll Survival or Perception. On a success, you gain +1 bonus die on your next roll this scene made to move through, reposition within, or brace against that environment. This does not detect threats or intentions.
talent_draevi_shared_burden_shared_breat: Type: Special Immediate (Endurance Aid) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When an ally within Short range fails a CON, Athletics, or Survival roll to endure fatigue, exposure, or environmental hardship, they may immediately reroll the check and take the second result. If the reroll succeeds, you regain 1 Strain as the shared effort steadies you rather than exhausting you.
talent_draevi_stand_when_others_stagger_: Type: Reaction (Endurance Check) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When you fail a CON or Athletics roll made to resist fatigue, environmental stress, knockdown, or forced repositioning, you may immediately reroll the check and take the second result. This reroll cannot be further modified.
talent_draevi_stonewise_bearing_rules-u: Type: Passive (Environmental Literacy) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — You treat difficult, unstable, or uneven physical terrain as manageable for the purpose of movement and positioning. You do not suffer penalty dice or additional movement costs from rubble, loose ground, broken infrastructure, or natural hazards when repositioning deliberately. This does not increase speed, negate forced movement, or prevent falls caused by external force.
talent_draevi_those_who_walked_before_ru: Type: Special Immediate (Shared Memory) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When an ally within Short range hesitates, falters, or fails a roll tied to judgment, morale, or decisive action, they may immediately reroll the check and take the second result. This cannot be used on attack rolls.
talent_draevi_unbroken_path_rules-u: Type: Special Immediate (Continuity Assertion) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When a coordinated movement, journey, or escape would fail due to confusion, obstruction, or loss of direction, one failed Navigation, Survival, or positioning-related roll made as part of that effort is treated as a success. This represents practiced continuity rather than improvisation.
talent_draevi_voice_of_those_who_remain_: Type: Free Action (Rally of Purpose) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you state a clear, shared objective during a tense scene, choose up to three allies within Short range who can hear you. The first roll each chosen ally makes that directly advances that stated objective gains +1 bonus die. This effect lasts until used or until the scene ends.
talent_draevi_weight_of_presence_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Stabilizing Authority) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When chaos, panic, or instability threatens to scatter a group in a physical space, allies within Short range who can see you gain +1 bonus die on rolls to resist fear, disorientation, or rash action until the start of your next turn.
talent_draevi_whispers_of_what_was_rules: Type: Action (Ancestral Vision) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you pause in a location shaped by past movement, conflict, loss, or shared use, you still yourself and listen for what the place remembers. You receive fragmented, symbolic visions of events that occurred there in the past, shown as impressions, images, or moments without narration or explanation. These visions never reveal the future and never answer questions directly. After receiving the vision, you gain +1 bonus die on your next roll made this scene to investigate, interpret, or contextualize the location or revealed events using Spirit Lore, History, Survival, or Occult Lore. This bonus applies only to understanding and interpretation, not to direct action or combat.
talent_feran_ambush_instincts_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Pre-Init Move) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When combat begins, before Initiative is rolled, take one Free Movement (shift 1 range band).
talent_feran_apex_reflex_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Counter Pounce) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After you successfully Dodge a melee attack, shift 1 range band without Disengaging and make one free Unarmed or Melee attack against a different target.
talent_feran_battle_rush_clarity_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Pain Focus) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you suffer any damage, regain 2 Strain and ignore movement penalties from wounds until the end of your next turn.
talent_feran_bloodrushed_recovery_rules-: Type: Special immediate (Adrenal Surge) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you take damage, regain 2 Strain and gain +1 bonus die on your next Dodge.
talent_feran_chain_strike_instinct_rules: Type: Special immediate (Finish & Flow) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — If you reduce a target to 0 HP with melee/unarmed, shift to a second target in Engaged and make one free attack.
talent_feran_ghostclaw_alpha_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Pre-Init Burst) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Before Initiative is rolled, take one of: move Short, make one melee/unarmed attack, or attempt to enter Stealth or Cover (if plausible).
talent_feran_pack_alphas_demand_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Command) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Choose up to two allies within Short. Until the start of your next turn, each gains +1 bonus die on Dodge or melee attacks (choose per ally).
talent_feran_pack_memory_living_instinct: Type: Free Action (Pack Call) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Declare Pack Call: for the rest of the scene, up to two allies within Short gain +10% to Dodge or Athletics (choose per ally), may reroll one failed melee attack or Dodge, and do not trigger Reactions when moving toward you.
talent_feran_pack_sense_reversal_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Bodyguard) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — If an ally within Short is targeted by a melee attack, swap positions as a Reaction. If you then successfully Dodge, make one free Unarmed attack against the attacker (if still in range).
talent_feran_pounce_and_break_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Debuff) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — If you hit a melee attack against a surprised or unaware target, that target suffers 1 penalty die on their next Dodge or Attack.
talent_feran_predators_focus_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Assess) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Gain +1 bonus die on Perception or Insight to assess danger, detect motion, or track prey.
talent_feran_predators_patience_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Ambush Prep) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — If you remain in Stealth or Cover for a full round, your next melee or ranged attack from hiding gains +1 bonus die.
talent_feran_predators_terrain_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Hunting Ground) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Designate a terrain type (rubble, scaffolding, overgrowth, etc.). While within it, you gain +1 bonus die to Dodge and Athletics, and enemies suffer 1 penalty die on ranged attacks against you.
talent_feran_pulse_lock_drive_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Stride & Strike) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After a successful melee/unarmed attack, shift 1 range band and make one free attack against a second target. This movement does not trigger Reactions. If both attacks hit, regain 2 Strain and enemies within Short suffer 1 penalty die on Dodge vs your attacks until end of your next turn.
talent_feran_razorstep_pounce_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Follow-up) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — After a successful Unarmed attack, make one additional Unarmed attack against another target in Engaged — or one in Short if you move (may trigger Reactions).
talent_feran_scavengers_instinct_rules-u: Type: Passive (Aptitude) • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Choose one: +10% to Streetwise, Survival (Urban), or Navigate (once only).
talent_feran_scent_of_the_kill_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Mark) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After you succeed on Track, gain +1 bonus die on your next Attack, Insight, or Streetwise involving that same target.
talent_feran_scentlock_tactics_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Mark+) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After a successful Track or observing a target for a round, gain +1 bonus die on your next Attack, Insight, or Streetwise against that target.
talent_feran_silent_leap_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Reposition) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Gain +1 bonus die on Stealth or Athletics when repositioning from concealment or into cover (ambush or disengage into cover).
talent_feran_stalkers_cascade_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Follow-up) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — If you begin your turn unseen and hit with a melee/unarmed attack, make one second attack with +1 bonus die. If both hit, the target suffers 1 penalty die on their next action.
talent_feran_threadbound_mastery_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Scene Stance) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — For the rest of the scene, ignore terrain penalties and once per round may shift 1 range band as a Free Action so long as the movement includes climbing, leaping, or difficult ground.
talent_feran_threadrunners_poise_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Stance) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Ignore terrain penalties from unstable/narrow/shifting ground for the rest of the scene.
talent_feran_threadwalkers_rhythm_rules-: Type: Free Action (Scene Stance) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — For one scene, ignore terrain penalties and gain +1 bonus die to Athletics to navigate difficult/unstable/vertical ground.
talent_feran_wallrunners_step_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Traverse) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Gain +1 bonus die on Athletics or Coordination while navigating vertical/narrow/unstable terrain.
talent_human_bad_idea_lets_go_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Overcommitment) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When you attempt a skill check under risky, rushed, or clearly suboptimal conditions, you may commit fully before rolling. If you do, ignore one penalty die imposed by circumstance on that roll. Once this commitment is declared, the roll must be resolved immediately and cannot be pushed, delayed, withdrawn, or reattempted later in the scene. If the roll fails, all consequences apply normally.
talent_human_borrowed_authority_rules-u: Type: Action (Assumed Legitimacy) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When dealing with a person, group, or system that expects expertise, rank, or credentials you do not actually possess, you may proceed as though you plausibly belong there long enough to attempt one relevant social or technical roll. This does not grant trust, immunity, or lasting access, and failure results in immediate suspicion or escalation.
talent_human_close_enough_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Messy Progress) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When you fail a non-combat skill check by 5% or less, you may refuse the stall. The action produces unstable, partial, or temporary progress appropriate to the attempt while still introducing risk, cost, or complication. This does not convert failure into a clean success, does not negate consequences, and cannot be used if the roll fails by more than 5%.
talent_human_educated_guess_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Substitute) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Use Education in place of any untrained knowledge skill (Arcana, Occult Lore, Forbidden Lore, History, Law, etc.) at one difficulty higher.
talent_human_hold_it_together_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Last Moment Control) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When a structure, device, vehicle, or mechanical system you are directly interacting with would fail, collapse, shut down, or break during the current round, you may delay that failure until the end of your next round. Until then, it remains functional only for the purpose of completing actions already in progress or actions you take before that time. When the delay ends, the failure occurs immediately and fully. This does not negate damage, prevent collapse, restore function, or make the situation safe.
talent_human_if_this_works_we_win_rules-: Type: Action (All-In Commitment) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Choose one clearly defined objective that would decisively end or turn the scene if completed. Until the end of the scene, all of your actions must directly advance that objective. While doing so, you gain +1 bonus die on skill rolls made toward it. This bonus applies only once per round. If the objective is completed, the scene immediately resolves or shifts in your favor. If you fail or abandon the objective, consequences escalate sharply and immediately.
talent_human_ill_handle_it_rules-u: Type: Action (Unqualified Attempt) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When you attempt a skill check using a skill in which you are untrained, you may roll using your EDU instead of the skill’s normal value. This roll is treated as one difficulty step harder than normal. This does not count as being trained for any purpose and cannot be used to meet prerequisites. If the roll fails, consequences apply normally and reflect poor technique, guesswork, or incomplete understanding.
talent_human_ill_take_the_hit_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Deliberate Sacrifice) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When an ally within Short range would suffer damage or a condition that would remove them from meaningful participation in the scene, you may take that damage or condition instead. All effects apply to you exactly as if you were the original target. This transfer cannot be reduced, redirected, delayed, or avoided. If the effect would incapacitate you, it does so.
talent_human_inside_the_blast_radius_rul: Type: Reaction (Survival Instinct) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When you enter or remain within an active environmental hazard such as fire, structural collapse, suppression, system overload, Veil disturbance, or similar lethal zone, you may trigger this talent. Until the end of the scene, you ignore one penalty die imposed by environmental danger on skill rolls, attack rolls, or Dodge rolls made while operating within that hazard. You still suffer all normal damage, conditions, and consequences caused by the environment, and any additional penalty dice beyond the first apply normally.
talent_human_it_only_has_to_work_once-u: It Only Has to Work Once
talent_human_it_only_has_to_work_once_ru: Type: Action (Improvised Sufficiency) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When you attempt a task using inadequate tools, unstable systems, or incomplete setup that you know is unreliable, you may force the attempt anyway. Resolve the roll using the appropriate skill at one difficulty step harder, but gain +1 bonus die. On a success, the result functions only long enough to achieve the immediate objective, then degrades, fails, or creates follow-up problems. On a failure, consequences apply normally and are exacerbated by the improvised method.
talent_human_ive_been_in_worse_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Refusal to Fall) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When you would suffer a Major Wound, become Exhausted, or gain a condition that would remove you from action, you may ignore that effect until the end of the scene. You may act normally, but you cannot recover Strain, remove conditions, or benefit from effects that reduce damage or mitigate harm. When the scene ends, all ignored effects apply immediately and in full.
talent_human_ive_run_worse_odds_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Calculated Defiance) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When you are faced with a situation where the rules, conditions, or circumstances would force you to withdraw, fail automatically, or abandon an objective, you may choose to attempt a risky alternative instead. Make the first skill roll required to pursue that alternative with +1 bonus die. This does not negate danger, remove conditions, or soften consequences; it allows you to act decisively when the system says retreat or failure is the safer option.
talent_human_make_it_someones_problem_ru: Type: Action (Forced Escalation) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When a situation is stalled, ignored, or deliberately avoided by those in power, you may take decisive action that makes continued inaction impossible. Choose a single authority, system, or group present in the scene and immediately attempt a relevant skill check to force their attention through disruption, exposure, or pressure. On a success, the situation escalates and must be addressed directly. On a failure, consequences apply normally and fall on you first. This does not grant cooperation or success; it forces response.
talent_human_make_it_work_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Salvage Improvisation) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When you fail a skill check, instead of pushing the roll, you may immediately abandon the original method and force progress through a clearly inferior or improvised approach that uses a different relevant skill appropriate to how you change tactics. This second roll is treated as one difficulty step harder, cannot be pushed, and does not replace the original failure. If it succeeds, the objective advances in a compromised or unstable way. If it fails, the situation escalates with additional consequences tied to the improvised approach.
talent_human_never_tell_me_the_odds_rule: Type: Special (Defiant Resolution) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When you attempt a single skill-based action whose success would decisively alter the scene, you do not roll to determine success. The action automatically succeeds. Immediately after, roll the appropriate skill to determine the severity of consequences caused by forcing the outcome. On a Success, the consequences are minor and contained. On a Failure, the consequences are serious and disruptive. On a Fumble, the consequences are catastrophic and lasting. This roll cannot be pushed, assisted, or modified, and this talent cannot be used for attacks.
talent_human_right_tool_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Improvised Solution) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When you would normally require specialized equipment, preparation, or setup to attempt a task, you may attempt it immediately using whatever is on hand. The roll resolves at one difficulty step harder, and any failure produces additional wear, loss, or exposure tied to the improvised method.
talent_human_someone_has_to_do_it_rules-: Type: Action (Assumed Burden) • Cost: 2d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When you attempt a task that is necessary to resolve the scene and failure would impose consequences on multiple allies, civilians, or the wider situation, you may declare this talent before rolling. Resolve the attempt normally. If the roll fails, you alone suffer all narrative, social, positional, or situational consequences that would have affected others. Secondary effects that are unavoidable still occur. This talent does not guarantee success or safety; it allows the scene to continue by placing the cost entirely on you.
talent_human_still_standing_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Refusal) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you would be knocked Prone, disarmed, or momentarily disrupted short of Incapacitation, you remain upright and retain control of your position. This does not negate damage, prevent conditions, or stop follow-up effects.
talent_human_this_is_on_me_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Consequence Redirection) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When a consequence, complication, or pressure would primarily affect an ally within Short range, you may take that consequence yourself instead. You cannot redirect damage this way, only narrative, positional, social, or situational fallout.
talent_human_too_late_to_stop_me_rules-u: Type: Action (Irreversible Commitment) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When you declare a dangerous action that would reasonably be interrupted, denied, delayed, or forced into withdrawal due to risk, opposition, or instability, you commit past the point of safe reversal. The action must be resolved immediately as a single attempt using the normal rules and cannot be voluntarily aborted, redirected, or postponed. When resolving a skill check as part of this action, you may ignore one penalty die imposed by circumstances that exist at the moment of declaration. This talent applies only to skill checks made to resolve the committed action. It does not grant success, protection, or immunity. Damage, conditions, countermeasures, and consequences apply normally during and after resolution, and failure escalates consequences appropriate to the scale of the commitment.
talent_human_wrong_place_right_time_rule: Type: Reaction (Opportunistic Entry) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When a scene shifts suddenly due to violence, exposure, or system failure, you may place yourself into the immediate action at Short range from a relevant threat, objective, or ally, provided it is physically plausible. This does not grant surprise or free actions; it represents being there when things break.
talent_khadra_ancestral_echo_guard_rules: Type: Free Action (Resist Magic) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When rolling Willpower or Arcana to resist a magical effect, call on ancestral resilience to gain +1 bonus die.
talent_khadra_anchorpoint_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Resist) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Gain +1 bonus die to resist being knocked prone, disarmed, or forcibly moved by terrain, shockwaves, or hostile powers.
talent_khadra_bastion_unyielding_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Bulwark) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Until end of the current round: gain +3 Damage Reduction (Physical) (stacks with other sources) and you cannot be pushed, pulled, or knocked prone.
talent_khadra_echo_of_the_first_stone_ru: Type: Free Action (Legacy Rite) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — For the rest of the scene, gain +1 bonus die to all CON and Willpower rolls, and automatically succeed on checks to remain conscious from wounds or magical shock. (Ends early if reduced to 0 HP.)
talent_khadra_echo_resonant_will_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Recover) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After succeeding on Willpower/Arcana to resist magical/spiritual effects, regain 1d6 Strain and gain +1 bonus die on your next roll.
talent_khadra_hold_the_line_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Intercept) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When an adjacent ally is targeted, intercept the blow: gain +1 bonus die to Dodge, or activate Weight of Stone to resist the damage.
talent_khadra_last_wall_protocol_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Stay Up) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you would be reduced to 0 HP or below by a physical attack, roll CON with +1 bonus die; on success, you are reduced to 1 HP instead and ignore excess damage.
talent_khadra_legacy_chainstrike_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Follow-up) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — After you hit with melee/unarmed, immediately make one second attack against a different Engaged enemy.
talent_khadra_legacy_of_iron_rules-u: Type: Passive (Aptitude) • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Choose one: +10% to Mechanics, Security Systems, or First Aid. (Once only.)

talent_khadra_weight_makes_the_weapon_ru: Type: Attack modifier • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — If you remained stationary on your last turn, your Melee/Unarmed attack gains +1 bonus die, and the target suffers 1 penalty die to resist knockback or disarm.

talent_kitsu_coded_whisper_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Subliminal) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Embed a hidden command/cue into a message/Illusion/phrase; gain +1 bonus die to your next Persuade, Slicing, or Enchantment tied to it.

talent_kitsu_phase_residue_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Echo) • Cost: — (Optional: 2 Strain to hinder a pursuer) • Usage: 1/Session — After using Blurring Veil or Flicker-Edge Movement, leave a Veil echo: gain +1 bonus die on your next Stealth or Dodge; optional: impose 1 penalty die on one pursuer’s Perception/Track this round.

talent_kitsu_rewired_pulse_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Retry + Discount) • Cost: — (Optional: 1 Strain for +1 die) • Usage: 1/Session — After Veil backlash, spell failure, or a Slicing fumble, instantly reroll the check and reduce its Strain cost by one die step; optional bonus die with the added Strain.

talent_kitsu_twitch_reflex_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Reactive Boost) • Cost: — (Optional: 1 Strain to trigger after your roll) • Usage: 1/Scene — Gain +1 bonus die on Initiative, Dodge, or Slicing during a high-stress moment (combat, pursuit, active scan).
talent_kitsu_urban_echo_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Query) • Cost: — (Optional: 1 Strain for +1 die while acting on it) • Usage: 1/Session — Ask the GM: “What’s the fastest way out/through?” If you act on that info, you may take the optional bonus on Athletics, Coordination, or Slicing.
talent_kitsu_veil_sniff_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Sense) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Detect nearby Veil anomalies (spirit traces, illusions, ambient corruption). Gain +1 bonus die on your next Arcana or Spirit Lore to analyze/counter it.
talent_kitsu_whisperstep_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Auto-Pass) • Cost: — (Optional: 1 Strain to bypass magical surveillance) • Usage: 1/Session — Automatically succeed on one Stealth check when moving shadow-to-shadow or across unstable ground.
talent_lyranni_arcane_composure_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Arcane Reserve) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene • Trigger: A creature you can perceive attempts to notice a spell being cast, prepared, or shaped by you, or you attempt to notice another creature casting or manipulating arcane energy. Perception and Arcana checks made to notice you casting or preparing a spell suffer one penalty die, and you gain +1 bonus die on Perception or Arcana checks made to notice another creature casting or manipulating arcane energy. This does not conceal overt spell effects once manifested and does not block direct magical detection or intrusion.
talent_lyranni_bearing_of_power_rules-u: Type: Passive (Veiled Authority) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — In social, political, or institutional contexts where arcane literacy, Veil familiarity, or magical lineage carries weight, you may gain +1 bonus die on a single social roll made to assert presence, claim relevance, or be taken seriously in matters involving the Veil or magical power. This does not grant obedience, trust, or immunity, and often places expectation or scrutiny on you in return. Your connection to the Veil is rarely neutral in such spaces.
talent_lyranni_between_the_currents_rule: Type: Action (Spirit Adjacency) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When spirits, echoes, or Veil entities are present in a scene, you may act as an intermediary without formal summoning or binding. Make a Veil Lore roll. On a success, you may pose one simple inquiry to the presence or receive one symbolic impression relevant to the scene. The response is indirect, incomplete, or metaphorical. This does not compel honesty, loyalty, or clarity. This exchange occurs once and does not allow follow-up questions.
talent_lyranni_born_adjacent_rules-u: Type: Passive (Veil Tolerance) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — When you are exposed to a Veil-based effect, hazard, anomaly, or environmental influence that requires a roll to resist, stabilize, endure, or remain functional, you gain +1 bonus die on the first such roll you make each scene. This applies only to effects originating from the Veil or arcane instability, not to mundane hazards or non-arcane conditions. This represents tolerance through familiarity, not protection, and does not stack with other ancestry-based resistances.
talent_lyranni_caste_memory_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Social Recall) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When interacting with a hierarchical organization, arcane institution, noble structure, or power-stratified group, you may declare this reaction to recall or recognize unspoken rank, obligation, or precedent. Gain +1 bonus die on your next roll this scene made to exploit, respect, or maneuver within that hierarchy. This does not grant authority; it grants understanding.
talent_lyranni_heir_to_the_veiled_houses: Type: Special (Inherited Authority) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When you formally assert your lineage, House ties, or cultural standing in a social, political, arcane, or spirit-mediated interaction, choose one audience present: mortals, spirits, or institutional actors. For the remainder of the scene, that audience must treat you as a legitimate stakeholder whose words carry consequence. The first attempt by that audience to dismiss, override, or disregard you without engagement suffers one penalty die, and you gain +1 bonus die on your next roll this scene to negotiate, assert precedent, invoke obligation, or demand acknowledgment. This does not compel obedience or trust and often invites scrutiny, challenge, or future consequence.
talent_lyranni_held_intent_rules-u: Type: Passive (Concealed Purpose) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Your true objectives are difficult to read. Opposed Insight, Perception, or magical sensing rolls made to determine your intent, emotional state, or immediate plans suffer one penalty die unless the observer has direct evidence or prolonged interaction. This does not prevent suspicion; it prevents certainty.
talent_lyranni_i_will_not_be_carried_rul: Type: Reaction (Defiant Continuance) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session • Trigger: A spell, Veil effect, spiritual influence, or supernatural event would incapacitate you, forcibly remove you from the scene, or otherwise end your meaningful participation. — The triggering effect resolves, but you remain conscious, present, and able to act until the scene ends. You take all damage normally and still accrue conditions as they occur, but none of those conditions may remove you from play until the scene concludes. You cannot recover Strain, reduce damage, or remove conditions during this time. When the scene ends, all delayed effects, conditions, and consequences apply immediately and in full. This talent does not protect allies, negate harm, or reduce cost; it ensures you are not erased from the moment.
talent_lyranni_let_it_pass_through_me_ru: Type: Reaction (Veil Mediation) • Cost: 2d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session • Trigger: A spell, Veil effect, spiritual influence, or supernatural action would directly affect multiple creatures, escalate beyond a single target, or impose widespread supernatural consequences. — You interpose yourself and force the effect to resolve through you. The effect still occurs, but all transferable portions of it—damage, conditions, spiritual influence, and narrative consequences—are redirected to you. When resolving those effects, choose one: halve the total damage dice rolled against you (round down); or reduce the severity or duration of one condition applied to you to its minimum value; or remove one secondary rider effect attached to the original effect. Any excess power displaced by this mediation bleeds into the surrounding environment or the Veil, creating an immediate and visible disturbance, scar, omen, or spiritual backlash. You suffer all remaining effects immediately and in full; this talent does not negate harm or prevent incapacitation. After the resolution, you may define how responsibility, blame, or obligation is perceived in the aftermath, subject to normal narrative adjudication.
talent_lyranni_quiet_read_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Assessment) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After observing a social interaction, negotiation, or confrontation for a brief moment, roll Insight opposed by the highest POW present. On a success, the GM must answer one of the following truthfully: who currently holds real leverage, who is concealing intent, or whether the situation is more likely to escalate or stall. This does not reveal plans, secrets, or future actions; it reveals pressure points.
talent_lyranni_spirit_marked_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Veil Claim) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When a spirit, Veil entity, or arcane remnant directly interacts with you through influence, communication, possession attempt, or attack, you may assert recognition. Until the end of the scene, that entity suffers one penalty die on rolls made to deceive, surprise, or overwhelm you. This does not grant control, immunity, or protection.
talent_lyranni_the_veil_knows_my_name_ru: Type: Special (Recognized Presence) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When you enter a scene containing a spirit, Veil entity, corrupted zone, or active arcane phenomenon, you may declare this talent. Until the end of the scene, Veil-aligned forces recognize you as an acknowledged actor rather than an intrusion. They do not automatically escalate, reject, or target you solely for being present. The first hostile action taken directly against you by a Veil-aligned entity this scene suffers one penalty die. This does not prevent hostility, manipulation, collateral damage, or indirect harm. At the end of the scene, the GM establishes how the Veil records this recognition—favor, obligation, scrutiny, or resentment—which persists beyond the scene.
talent_lyranni_the_weight_before_the_ste: Type: Special (Veil Pressure Awareness) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When a spirit, Veil entity, summoning effect, breach, or supernatural intrusion would manifest, enter the scene, or exert influence during the current or next round within Medium range, the GM must alert you to the disturbance before it fully resolves, even if the source is concealed or indirect. Until the end of the scene, you perceive the entity’s tether to the world—whether it is summoned, bound, anchored, escaped, or freely present—and learn one structural truth about that tether chosen by the GM (such as what sustains it, what would weaken or sever it, what it is constrained from doing, or what kind of bargain or condition it responds to). In addition, choose one: gain +1 bonus die on your next roll this scene to banish, disrupt, bargain with, ward against, or safely withdraw from the entity; or grant that bonus to one ally acting on your insight before the end of the next round. This talent does not reveal intent, future actions, true names, or guaranteed solutions.
talent_lyranni_true_veilsight_rules-u: Type: Action (Perception) • Cost: 2 Strain (1 round) or 1d6 Strain (entire scene) • Usage: At will — You perceive Veil phenomena directly, including spirits, Veil entities, lingering arcane effects, corrupted zones, rifts, echoes, and magical residue. While True Veilsight is active, the first Arcana, Veil Lore, or Spirit Lore roll you make during its duration gains +1 bonus die. You may distinguish natural Veil fluctuation from deliberate arcane or spiritual influence, but you do not perceive spell formulas, prepared spells, or active casting mechanics. While active, you ignore penalties from low-light or shadowed conditions. This does not grant vision in total sensory voids and does not bypass non-Veil concealment.
talent_lyranni_unspoken_leverage_rules-u: Type: Passive (Social Pressure) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — In social scenes involving hierarchy, negotiation, or concealed power dynamics, neutral or hostile parties cannot treat you as harmless or irrelevant. The first roll made to dismiss, ignore, or bypass you without engagement suffers one penalty die. This does not compel respect or cooperation; it ensures your presence carries weight even when silent.
talent_lyranni_veil_hardened_mind_rules-: Type: Reaction (Arcane Resistance) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When you would gain Disoriented, Shaken, Panicked, Suppressed, or Stunned due to a spell, Veil effect, spiritual influence, or arcane pressure, reduce the severity or duration to the minimum possible. If the condition would last multiple rounds, it instead ends at the close of the current round. This does not negate damage or remove conditions entirely and does not apply to purely mundane sources.
talent_lyranni_veil_literate_rules-u: Type: Passive (Veil Literacy) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — The first time each scene that you make a Veil Lore roll to interpret, interact with, stabilize, or safely approach a Veil-based effect, phenomenon, entity, or environment, you gain +1 bonus die on that roll. Whether the roll succeeds or fails, you experience minor Veil feedback such as sensory distortion, emotional bleed-through, or physical discomfort that is noticeable but imposes no mechanical penalty. This feedback does not stack or escalate.
talent_lyranni_veil_touch_rules-u: Type: Action (Veil Contact) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — You deliberately make brief physical or near-physical contact with a creature, object, location, or effect that is actively influenced by the Veil. Roll Veil Lore. On a success, you gain clear, immediate insight into the nature of that influence, such as whether it is stable or unstable, bound or uncontrolled, deliberate or accidental. In addition, choose one: either you gain +1 bonus die on your next roll this scene made to interact with, analyze, disrupt, or resist that Veil influence, or you grant that same bonus to one ally who acts on your insight before the end of the current round. On a failure, you still sense the Veil’s presence, but suffer 1d4 Strain from arcane feedback.
talent_lyranni_veiled_composure_rules-u: Type: Passive (Controlled Presence) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — When you are subject to emotional pressure, intimidation, magical influence affecting mood or perception, or social provocation, you may ignore one penalty die imposed on social or Insight-based rolls caused by that pressure. This does not grant immunity to mind control, fear effects, or compulsion; it reflects disciplined restraint rather than resistance.
talent_lyranni_veilsight_rules-u: Type: Action (Sense) • Cost: 1 Strain (1 round) or 1d4 Strain (entire scene) • Usage: At-will — You open your perception to the Veil. While active, you can perceive spirits, Veil distortions, lingering magical effects, and arcane residues present in the environment. While Veilsight is active, you gain +1 bonus die on Veil Lore checks made to identify, analyze, or contextualize Veil phenomena. Veilsight reveals presence and nature only; it does not reveal intent, future outcomes, or grant control, and it does not replace investigation, divination, or spellcasting.
talent_veyra_battlefield_sync_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Pre-Init Move) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — If you win Initiative or succeed a Perception/Listen before combat, take one Maneuver before the first full round.

talent_veyra_echo_map_recall_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Pulse Scan) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — While stationary in total darkness, make a free Perception with +1 bonus die to detect movement/hidden creatures within Short–Medium, even if silent.

talent_veyra_neurospike_blur_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Veil State) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — For 1 round, your outline phases and your tech signature silences: ranged attacks cannot target you unless the attacker passes a Hard Perception (or uses magical means) to detect you.
talent_veyra_no_footprints_rules-u: Type: Passive (Silent Move) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — No movement penalty while using Stealth; move at full speed without increasing detection chance.
talent_veyra_nocturne_optimizer_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Low-Light Edge) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — In low-light/darkness, gain +1 bonus die to your next Mechanics, Electronics, or Stealth.
talent_veyra_overclock_instinct_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Field Check) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Instantly attempt Mechanics or Electronics on a damaged drone/vehicle/bot without tools and without using your Action. Does not provoke Reactions.
talent_veyra_patchwork_fixer_rules-u: Type: Passive (Aptitude) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — +10% to Mechanics and Electronics when working with scrap or improvised tools. Such repairs last one scene or until significantly stressed.
talent_veyra_ping_and_pull_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Remote Nudge) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After identifying a device via Circuit Whispers, immediately trigger an unsecured connected mechanism (basic lock/relay/actuator/panel) without a roll. If secured/magically reinforced/complex, instead gain +1 bonus die to your next Slicing/Electronics/Magic vs it.
talent_veyra_recursive_salvager_rules-u: Type: Passive (Upgrade) + Special • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When using Overclock Instinct, you may reroll that check once and ignore the first malfunction triggered by that repair/activation.
talent_veyra_reflex_map_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Pre-Init Maneuver) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After a successful Perception/Listen to detect danger, take one Free Maneuver before Initiative is rolled (defensive: move to cover, duck, shift, or warn an ally).
talent_veyra_salvage_sense_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Patch) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — When using Cache Sense, you may restore 1d6 HP to a drone/bot/vehicle or reduce a malfunction’s severity by 1 tier using repurposed scrap in the same scene.
talent_veyra_signal_evasion_loop_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Trace Suppress) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After you successfully use Signal Ghost to reroll Slicing/Security, you may suppress the next trace lock or countermeasure activation triggered against you.
talent_veyra_signal_ghost_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Reroll) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Reroll a failed Slicing or Security Systems check. If the reroll succeeds, no trace remains unless protected by active countermeasures.
talent_veyra_silent_cascade_rules-u: Type: Passive + Special (Sprint-Stealth) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will / 1/Session — At-will: +10% Stealth when moving at full speed. 1/Session: make a full movement + Stealth check as a Free Action (does not count as your turn).
talent_veyra_silent_dominion_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Scene Cloak+) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — For one scene, you move at full speed with no Stealth penalties. During this state, passive detection (visual/electronic/magical) must succeed one level higher than your success to perceive you.
talent_veyra_slip_between_rules-u: Type: Passive (Traversal) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Ignore movement penalties from tight spaces and gain +1 bonus die to Stealth when entering/exiting/navigating narrow areas (collapsed ducts, crawlways, maintenance shafts).
talent_veyra_stealth_harmonic_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Ally Echo) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After you successfully use Silent Cascade, grant 1 ally within Short +10% Stealth and let them move at full speed with you without penalty for that move.
talent_veyra_thread_the_vents_rules-u: Type: Passive (Squeeze Mastery) + Reaction (Reposition) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will / 1/Scene — At-will: No penalties when squeezing through ducts/tight corridors/debris zones. 1/Scene: As a Reaction, reposition to any Short-range location that shares Partial Cover.
talent_veyra_vent_ghost_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Cover Stance) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — While in Partial/Full Cover, gain +10% Dodge, and ranged attacks vs you are –10% until start of your next turn.
talent_veyra_zero_trace_protocol_rules-u: Type: Passive (Upgrade) • Cost: — • Usage: When you use Signal Ghost to reroll a failed Slicing or Security Systems check, choose one for that reroll: add +1 bonus die or ignore 1 penalty die from situational modifiers (noise, latency, light countermeasures).
temporary_employer_desc-u: Someone who offers short-term work and asks few questions, as long as you deliver.
tool_harness_desc-u: A worn but functional set of general tools suitable for industrial repair, maintenance, or fabrication.
transit_locker_desc-u: Personal effects, ration packs, and travel documentation from multiple ports, some expired, some still useful.
transit_network_contact_desc-u: Knows schedules, unofficial routes, and how to move quietly through controlled spaces.
translation_implant-u: A reprogrammed translation implant or sentimental token from your surrogate upbringing—worn smooth from years of fidgeting.
travel_pack_desc-u: Lightweight pack with preserved food, water filtration, layered clothing, and emergency shelter supplies.
unarmed_desc-u: TODO: add description for unarmed combat
union_or_work_crew_token_desc-u: Proof of past membership in a labor crew, shift collective, or industrial network that still looks out for its own.
vacuum_go_bag_desc-u: Emergency seals, environmental patches, compact oxygen reserve, and survival gear rated for hostile conditions.
veil_creature_token-u: A preserved Veil-creature token — fang, eye, or glyph-stone — kept in a claw-marked pouch
veil_lore_desc-u: TODO: add description for veil lore
veil_modulator-u: A home-built veil-modulator or cloaked commset passed down from a mentor, sibling, or crew.
veil_threaded_accessory-u: A Veil-threaded accessory — a wrap or pendant bearing minor cosmetic enchantment.
veilmark_living-sigil-u: A Veilmark — a living sigil that faintly reacts to arcane or spiritual anomalies.
violence-dec: A red mist descends on the investigator and they explode in a spree of uncontrolled violence and destruction directed at their surroundings, allies or foes alike.
violence-dec2: The investigator explodes in a spree of violence and destruction. When the investigator comes to their senses, their actions may or may not be apparent or remembered. Who or what the investigator has inflicted violence upon and whether they have killed or simply inflicted harm is up to the Keeper.
wardens_apprentice_discipline_token-u: A discipline token—flat stone etched with the name of your first post.
watcher_or_handler_desc-u: A figure tasked with monitoring, guiding, or retrieving members who stray too far.
work_through_it_desc-u: Once per session, when you fail a Mechanics, Electronics, or Tradecraft roll while repairing, building, or maintaining equipment, you may still complete the task at reduced effectiveness or increased wear, at the GM’s discretion. The job gets done—but something is stressed, degraded, or temporary. This feature reflects grit and experience, not perfection.
worn_map_set_desc-u: Physical or digital maps marked with personal annotations, dead routes, safe paths, and places you never return to.
